I burned down the town of Trebon. I have spent the night with Felurian and left with both my sanity and my life. I was expelled from the University at a younger age than most people are allowed in. I tread paths by moonlight that others fear to speak of during day. I have talked to Gods, loved women, and written songs that make the minstrels weep. You may have heard of me. So begins a tale unequaled in fantasy literature—the story of a hero told in his own voice. It is a tale of sorrow, a tale of survival, a tale of one man’s search for meaning in his universe, and how that search, and the indomitable will that drove it, gave birth to a legend.                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/24204/patrick-rothfuss">Patrick Rothfuss</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/20188/nick-podehl">Nick Podehl</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Brilliance Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">May 2009</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">28 hours 0 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Discover #1 New York Times-bestselling Patrick Rothfuss&#8217; epic fantasy series, The Kingkiller Chronicle.<br />\r\n&#8220;I just love the world of Patrick Rothfuss.&#8221; &#8212;Lin-Manuel Miranda &#8226; &#8220;He&#8217;s bloody good, this Rothfuss guy.&#8221; &#8212;George R. R. Martin &#8226; &#8220;Rothfuss has real talent.&#8221; &#8212;Terry Brooks<br />\r\nOVER 1 MILLION COPIES SOLD! <br />\r\nDAY ONE: THE NAME OF THE WIND<br />\r\nMy name is Kvothe.<br />\r\nI have stolen princesses back from sleeping barrow kings. I burned down the town of Trebon. I have spent the night with Felurian and left with both my sanity and my life. I was expelled from the University at a younger age than most people are allowed in. I tread paths by moonlight that others fear to speak of during day. I have talked to Gods, loved women, and written songs that make the minstrels weep.<br />\r\nYou may have heard of me.<br />\r\nSo begins a tale unequaled in fantasy literature&#8212;the story of a hero told in his own voice. It is a tale of sorrow, a tale of survival, a tale of one man&#8217;s search for meaning in his universe, and how that search, and the indomitable will that drove it, gave birth to a legend.  <br />\r\nPraise for The Kingkiller Chronicle: <br />\r\n &#8220;The best epic fantasy I read last year.... He&#8217;s bloody good, this Rothfuss guy.&#8221;<br />\r\n&#8212;George R. R. Martin, New York Times-bestselling author of A Song of Ice and Fire<br />\r\n &#8220;Rothfuss has real talent, and his tale of Kvothe is deep and intricate and wondrous.&#8221; <br />\r\n&#8212;Terry Brooks, New York Times-bestselling author of Shannara<br />\r\n\'It is a rare and great pleasure to find a fantasist writing...with true music in the words.\'<br />\r\n&#8212;Ursula K. Le Guin, award-winning author of Earthsea<br />\r\n\'The characters are real and the magic is true.&#8221; <br />\r\n&#8212;Robin Hobb, New York Times-bestselling author of Assassin&#8217;s Apprentice<br />\r\n\'Masterful.... There is a beauty to Pat\'s writing that defies description.\' <br />\r\n&#8212;Brandon Sanderson, New York Times-bestselling author of Mistborn</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n        <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">Wonderful story. I burned down the town of Trebon. I have spent the night with Felurian and left with both my sanity and my life. I was expelled from the University at a younger age than most people are allowed in.                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/24204/patrick-rothfuss">Patrick Rothfuss</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/20188/nick-podehl">Nick Podehl</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Brilliance Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">May 2009</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">28 hours 0 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Discover #1 New York Times-bestselling Patrick Rothfuss&#8217; epic fantasy series, The Kingkiller Chronicle.<br />\r\n&#8220;I just love the world of Patrick Rothfuss.&#8221; &#8212;Lin-Manuel Miranda &#8226; &#8220;He&#8217;s bloody good, this Rothfuss guy.&#8221; &#8212;George R. R. Martin &#8226; &#8220;Rothfuss has real talent.&#8221; &#8212;Terry Brooks<br />\r\nOVER 1 MILLION COPIES SOLD! <br />\r\nDAY ONE: THE NAME OF THE WIND<br />\r\nMy name is Kvothe.<br />\r\nI have stolen princesses back from sleeping barrow kings. I burned down the town of Trebon. I have spent the night with Felurian and left with both my sanity and my life. I was expelled from the University at a younger age than most people are allowed in. I tread paths by moonlight that others fear to speak of during day. I have talked to Gods, loved women, and written songs that make the minstrels weep.<br />\r\nYou may have heard of me.<br />\r\nSo begins a tale unequaled in fantasy literature&#8212;the story of a hero told in his own voice. It is a tale of sorrow, a tale of survival, a tale of one man&#8217;s search for meaning in his universe, and how that search, and the indomitable will that drove it, gave birth to a legend.  <br />\r\nPraise for The Kingkiller Chronicle: <br />\r\n &#8220;The best epic fantasy I read last year.... He&#8217;s bloody good, this Rothfuss guy.&#8221;<br />\r\n&#8212;George R. R. Martin, New York Times-bestselling author of A Song of Ice and Fire<br />\r\n &#8220;Rothfuss has real talent, and his tale of Kvothe is deep and intricate and wondrous.&#8221; <br />\r\n&#8212;Terry Brooks, New York Times-bestselling author of Shannara<br />\r\n\'It is a rare and great pleasure to find a fantasist writing...with true music in the words.\'<br />\r\n&#8212;Ursula K. Le Guin, award-winning author of Earthsea<br />\r\n\'The characters are real and the magic is true.&#8221; <br />\r\n&#8212;Robin Hobb, New York Times-bestselling author of Assassin&#8217;s Apprentice<br />\r\n\'Masterful.... There is a beauty to Pat\'s writing that defies description.\' <br />\r\n&#8212;Brandon Sanderson, New York Times-bestselling author of Mistborn</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/24204/patrick-rothfuss">Patrick Rothfuss</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/24204/patrick-rothfuss">Patrick Rothfuss</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Penguin Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">October 2014</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">3 hours 39 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Discover #1 New York Times-bestselling Patrick Rothfuss&rsquo; epic fantasy universe of The Kingkiller Chronicle, in this illustrated companion novella, The Slow Regard of Silent Things. <br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;I just love the world of Patrick Rothfuss.&rdquo; &mdash;Lin-Manuel Miranda &bull; &ldquo;He&rsquo;s bloody good, this Rothfuss guy.&rdquo; &mdash;George R. R. Martin &bull; &ldquo;Rothfuss has real talent.&rdquo; &mdash;Terry Brooks<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Deep below the University, there is a dark place. Few people know of it: a broken web of ancient passageways and abandoned rooms. A young woman lives there, tucked among the sprawling tunnels of the Underthing, snug in the heart of this forgotten place.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Her name is Auri, and she is full of mysteries.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n The Slow Regard of Silent Things is a brief, bittersweet glimpse of Auri&rsquo;s life, a small adventure all her own. At once joyous and haunting, this story offers a chance to see the world through Aurir&rsquo;s eyes. And it gives the reader a chance to learn things that only Auri knows....<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n In this book, Patrick Rothfuss brings us into the world of one of The Kingkiller Chronicle&rsquo;s most enigmatic characters. Full of secrets and mysteries, The Slow Regard of Silent Things is the story of a broken girl trying to live in a broken world. <br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for The Kingkiller Chronicle:<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The best epic fantasy I read last year.... He&rsquo;s bloody good, this Rothfuss guy.&rdquo;<br />\r\n &mdash;George R. R. Martin, New York Times-bestselling author of A Song of Ice and Fire<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Rothfuss has real talent, and his tale of Kvothe is deep and intricate and wondrous.&rdquo; <br />\r\n &mdash;Terry Brooks, New York Times-bestselling author of Shannara<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n \'It is a rare and great pleasure to find a fantasist writing...with true music in the words.\'<br />\r\n &mdash;Ursula K. Le Guin, award-winning author of Earthsea<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n \'The characters are real and the magic is true.&rdquo; <br />\r\n &mdash;Robin Hobb, New York Times-bestselling author of Assassin&rsquo;s Apprentice<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n \'Masterful.... There is a beauty to Pat\'s writing that defies description.\' <br />\r\n &mdash;Brandon Sanderson, New York Times-bestselling author of Mistborn</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy" genre-id="1"><span itemprop="title">Science Fiction & Fantasy</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy/fantasy" genre-id="2"><span itemprop="title">Fantasy</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div                                          <h5 class="nopadding">Kevin C.</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="5"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">Auri is one of the most amazing characters I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever read. So good.</p>\r\n                                                <p class="tright nomargin review-helpfulness">1 of 1 people found this review helpful.</p>                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Brock Vardsveen</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="2"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">It\'s short... It\'s short... It\'s short... The book is short and hard to follow.</p>\r\n                                                <p class="tright nomargin review-helpfulness">1 of 1 people found this review helpful.</p>                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Diana R.</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="5"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">Yes, the book is short. I never found it hard to follow. I actually adored that Audi\xe2\x80\x99s story is narrated by Patrick himself. No one else could have done it justice. The note at the end, where he says it\xe2\x80\x99s not for everyone made me cry. It\xe2\x80\x99s my story too. Ty P.R. - it was excellent and I patiently await any new or revised stories from you.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                </ul>\r\n                            </div>\r\n                            <div id="tab-social" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: none;">Donec in tortor in lectus iaculis vulputate. Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper.                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/24204/patrick-rothfuss">Patrick Rothfuss</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Brilliance Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">March 2011</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">43 hours 0 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Discover #1 New York Times-bestselling Patrick Rothfuss&#8217; epic fantasy series, The Kingkiller Chronicle.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&#8220;I just love the world of Patrick Rothfuss.&#8221; &#8212;Lin-Manuel Miranda &#8226; &#8220;He&#8217;s bloody good, this Rothfuss guy.&#8221; &#8212;George R. R. Martin &#8226; &#8220;Rothfuss has real talent.&#8221; &#8212;Terry Brooks<br />\r\n<br />\r\nDAY TWO: THE WISE MAN&#8217;S FEAR<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&#8220;There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon, and the anger of a gentle man.&#8221;<br />\r\n<br />\r\nMy name is Kvothe. You may have heard of me.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nSo begins a tale told from his own point of view&#8212;a story unequaled in fantasy literature. Now in The Wise Man&#8217;s Fear, Day Two of The Kingkiller Chronicle, Kvothe takes his first steps on the path of the hero and learns how difficult life can be when a man becomes a legend in his own time.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy" genre-id="1"><span itemprop="title">Science Fiction & Fantasy</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url"            <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/24204/patrick-rothfuss">Patrick Rothfuss</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/177331/ra-l-llorens">Ra\xc3\xbal Llorens</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Penguin Random House Grupo Editorial</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">June 2016</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">44 hours 47 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                        <h4 class="book-language">Language: <span class="nobold">Spanish</span></h4>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Escucha ahora El temor de un hombre sabio, la esperada continuaci\xc3\xb3n de la historia de Kvothe y El nombre del viento.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xabTodo hombre sabio teme tres cosas: la tormenta en el mar, la noche sin luna y la ira de un hombre amable.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\n<br />\r\n El hombre hab\xc3\xada desaparecido. El mito no. M\xc3\xbasico, mendigo, ladr\xc3\xb3n,  estudiante, mago, trotamundos, h\xc3\xa9roe y asesino, Kvothe hab\xc3\xada borrado su  rastro. Y ni siquiera ahora que le han encontrado, ni siquiera ahora que  las tinieblas invaden los rincones del mundo, est\xc3\xa1 dispuesto a regresar.  Pero su historia prosigue, la aventura contin\xc3\xbaa, y Kvothe  seguir\xc3\xa1 cont\xc3\xa1ndola para revelar la verdad tras la leyenda.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xabMe llamo Kvothe. Quiz\xc3\xa1 hayas o\xc3\xaddo hablar de m\xc3\xad...\xc2\xbb<br />\r\n<br />\r\n  La cr\xc3\xadtica ha dicho...<br />\r\n\xc2\xabLa nueva promesa de la literatura fant\xc3\xa1stica.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\nQu\xc3\xa9 leer<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xabEl Tolkien estadounidense.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\nJuan G\xc3\xb3mez-Jurado, ABC</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper. 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9788401017025.jpg', None, 'Atípica, profunda y sincera, El nombre del viento es una novela  de aventuras, de historias dentro de otras historias, de misterio, de amistad, de amor, de magia y de superación. Escucha ahora la novela que ha consagrado a Patrick Rothfuss como fenómeno editorial de los últimos años. En una posada en tierra de nadie, un hombre se dispone a relatar, por  primera vez, la auténtica historia de su vida. Una historia que únicamente él conoce y que ha quedado diluida tras los rumores, las conjeturas y los cuentos de taberna que le han convertido en un personaje legendario a quien todos daban ya por muerto: Kvothe... músico, mendigo, ladrón, estudiante, mago, héroe y asesino. Ahora va a revelar la verdad sobre sí mismo. Y para ello debe empezar  por el principio: su infancia en una troupe de artistas itinerantes, los años malviviendo como un ladronzuelo en las calles de una gran ciudad y su llegada a una universidad donde esperaba encontrar todas las respuestas que había estado buscando. «Viajé, amé, perdí, confié y me traicionaron.» «He robado princesas a reyes agónicos. Incendié la ciudad de Trebon. He pasado la noche con Felurian y he despertado vivo y cuerdo. Me expulsaron de la Universidad a una edad a la que a la mayoría todavía no los dejan entrar. He recorrido de noche caminos de los que otros no se atreven a hablar ni siquiera de día. He hablado con dioses, he amado a mujeres y he escrito canciones que hacen llorar a los bardos. »Me llamo Kvothe. Quizá hayas oído hablar de mí.» La crítica ha dicho... «Una estupenda y fuera de lo común novela de aventuras fantásticas.» Justo Navarro, El País «Sin duda El nombre del viento se convertirá en un clásico.» TheTimes «Un libro para quien conoce el mágico poder de las palabras.» Ricard Ruiz Garzón, El Periódico de Catalunya «Una aventura insólita y preciosa. Una historia que &uacute;nicamente &eacute;l conoce y que ha quedado diluida tras los rumores, las conjeturas y los cuentos de taberna que le han convertido en un personaje legendario a quien todos daban ya por muerto: Kvothe... m&uacute;sico, mendigo, ladr&oacute;n, estudiante, mago, h&eacute;roe y asesino.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Ahora va a revelar la verdad sobre s&iacute; mismo. Y para ello debe empezar  por el principio: su infancia en una troupe de artistas itinerantes, los a&ntilde;os malviviendo como un ladronzuelo en las calles de una gran ciudad y su llegada a una universidad donde esperaba encontrar todas las respuestas que hab&iacute;a estado buscando.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &laquo;Viaj&eacute;, am&eacute;, perd&iacute;, confi&eacute; y me traicionaron.&raquo;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &laquo;He robado princesas a reyes ag&oacute;nicos. Incendi&eacute; la ciudad de Trebon. He pasado la noche con Felurian y he despertado vivo y cuerdo. Me expulsaron de la Universidad a una edad a la que a la mayor&iacute;a todav&iacute;a no los dejan entrar. He recorrido de noche caminos de los que otros no se atreven a hablar ni siquiera de d&iacute;a. He hablado con dioses, he amado a mujeres y he escrito canciones que hacen llorar a los bardos.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &raquo;Me llamo Kvothe. Quiz&aacute; hayas o&iacute;do hablar de m&iacute;.&raquo;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n  La cr&iacute;tica ha dicho...&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&laquo;Una estupenda y fuera de lo com&uacute;n novela de aventuras fant&aacute;sticas.&raquo;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nJusto Navarro, El Pa&iacute;s&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &laquo;Sin duda El nombre del viento se convertir&aacute; en un cl&aacute;sico.&raquo;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nTheTimes&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &laquo;Un libro para quien conoce el m&aacute;gico poder de las palabras.&raquo;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nRicard Ruiz Garz&oacute;n, El Peri&oacute;dico de Catalunya&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &laquo;Una aventura ins&oacute;lita y preciosa. Puntuaci&oacute;n: Sobresaliente.&raquo;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nManu Gonz&aacute;lez, Qu&eacute; Leer&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &laquo;No sucede a menudo, pero El nombre del viento de Patrick Rothfuss s&iacute; es tan bueno como dicen las rese&ntilde;as.&raquo;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nLocus&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &laquo;Llena de m&uacute;sica, magia, amor y p&eacute;rdida, el absorbente y vivo debut de Patrick Rothfuss nos ha deslumbrado.&raquo;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nAmazon.com&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &laquo;A veces, con suerte y unas cuantas recomendaciones de buenos amigos, se vuelve a descubrir otro para&iacute;so en el que quedarse, un par  de semanas, unos cuantos d&iacute;as. Y eso es justo lo que me ha pasado con El nombre  del viento.&raquo;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nToni Rodero, La Voz de Avil&eacute;s"/>\n\t\n    \n\t<title>Listen to El nombre del viento (Cr\xc3\xb3nica del                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/24204/patrick-rothfuss">Patrick Rothfuss</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/177331/ra-l-llorens">Ra\xc3\xbal Llorens</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Penguin Random House Grupo Editorial</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">March 2016</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">27 hours 20 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                        <h4 class="book-language">Language: <span class="nobold">Spanish</span></h4>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">At\xc3\xadpica, profunda y sincera, El nombre del viento es una novela  de aventuras, de historias dentro de otras historias, de misterio, de amistad, de amor, de magia y de superaci\xc3\xb3n.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n Escucha ahora la novela que ha consagrado a Patrick Rothfuss como fen\xc3\xb3meno editorial de los \xc3\xbaltimos a\xc3\xb1os.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n En una posada en tierra de nadie, un hombre se dispone a relatar, por  primera vez, la aut\xc3\xa9ntica historia de su vida. Una historia que \xc3\xbanicamente \xc3\xa9l conoce y que ha quedado diluida tras los rumores, las conjeturas y los cuentos de taberna que le han convertido en un personaje legendario a quien todos daban ya por muerto: Kvothe... m\xc3\xbasico, mendigo, ladr\xc3\xb3n, estudiante, mago, h\xc3\xa9roe y asesino.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n Ahora va a revelar la verdad sobre s\xc3\xad mismo. Y para ello debe empezar  por el principio: su infancia en una troupe de artistas itinerantes, los a\xc3\xb1os malviviendo como un ladronzuelo en las calles de una gran ciudad y su llegada a una universidad donde esperaba encontrar todas las respuestas que hab\xc3\xada estado buscando.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xabViaj\xc3\xa9, am\xc3\xa9, perd\xc3\xad, confi\xc3\xa9 y me traicionaron.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xabHe robado princesas a reyes ag\xc3\xb3nicos. Incendi\xc3\xa9 la ciudad de Trebon. He pasado la noche con Felurian y he despertado vivo y cuerdo. Me expulsaron de la Universidad a una edad a la que a la mayor\xc3\xada todav\xc3\xada no los dejan entrar. He recorrido de noche caminos de los que otros no se atreven a hablar ni siquiera de d\xc3\xada. He hablado con dioses, he amado a mujeres y he escrito canciones que hacen llorar a los bardos.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xbbMe llamo Kvothe. Quiz\xc3\xa1 hayas o\xc3\xaddo hablar de m\xc3\xad.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\n<br />\r\n  La cr\xc3\xadtica ha dicho...<br />\r\n\xc2\xabUna estupenda y fuera de lo com\xc3\xban novela de aventuras fant\xc3\xa1sticas.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\nJusto Navarro, El Pa\xc3\xads<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xabSin duda El nombre del viento se convertir\xc3\xa1 en un cl\xc3\xa1sico.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\nTheTimes<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xabUn libro para quien conoce el m\xc3\xa1gico poder de las palabras.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\nRicard Ruiz Garz\xc3\xb3n, El Peri\xc3\xb3dico de Catalunya<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xabUna aventura ins\xc3\xb3lita y preciosa. Puntuaci\xc3\xb3n: Sobresaliente.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\nManu Gonz\xc3\xa1lez, Qu\xc3\xa9 Leer<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xabNo sucede a menudo, pero El nombre del viento de Patrick Rothfuss s\xc3\xad es tan bueno como dicen las rese\xc3\xb1as.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\nLocus<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xabLlena de m\xc3\xbasica, magia, amor y p\xc3\xa9rdida, el absorbente y vivo debut de Patrick Rothfuss nos ha deslumbrado.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\nAmazon.com<br />\r\n<br />\r\n \xc2\xabA veces, con suerte y unas cuantas recomendaciones de buenos amigos, se vuelve a descubrir otro para\xc3\xadso en el que quedarse, un par  de semanas, unos cuantos d\xc3\xadas. Y eso es justo lo que me ha pasado con El nombre  del viento.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\nToni Rodero, La Voz de Avil\xc3\xa9s</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" genre-id="2"><span itemprop="title">Fantasy</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div class="line"></div>\r\n\r\n                    <!-- Similar Titles and Also Customers Bought Tab Widget -->\r\n                    <div class="tab_widget" id="book-details-similar-titles-tab">\r\n                   <div class="tab_container">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<div id="tab-similar" data-context="/categoryList/similarTitles" data-bookId="291402" class="shelf tab_content clearfix"                 <div id="tab-reviews" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: block;">\r\n                                <ul class="sposts-list clearfix">\r\n                                                                    \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Guisela S.</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="5"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">Al principio puede parecer algo lento y lioso, pero si pasas el primer tramo te enganchas y es un buen compa\xc3\xb1ero de viaje. Lo aconsejo para gente creativa e inteligente.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                </ul>\r\n                            </div>\r\n                            <div id="tab-social" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: none;">Donec in tortor in lectus iaculis vulputate. Sed aliquam, urna ut sollicitudin molestie, lacus justo aliquam mauris, interdum aliquam sapien nisi cursus mauris. Nunc hendrerit tortor vitae est placerat ut varius erat posuere. Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus.</div>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                    </div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\r\n Whisked from her home in Cairo, she was thrust into the dazzling royal court of Daevabad&mdash;and quickly discovered she would need all her grifter instincts to survive there. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nNow, with Daevabad entrenched in the dark aftermath of a devastating battle, Nahri must forge a new path for herself. But even as she embraces her heritage and the power it holds, she knows she&rsquo;s been trapped in a gilded cage, watched by a king who rules from the throne that once belonged to her family&mdash;and one misstep will doom her tribe..&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nMeanwhile, Ali has been exiled for daring to defy his father. Hunted by assassins, adrift on the unforgiving copper sands of his&amp;#160;ancestral land, he is forced to rely on the frightening abilities the marid&mdash;the unpredictable water spirits&mdash;have gifted him. But in doing so, he threatens to unearth a terrible secret his family has long kept buried.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nAnd as&amp;#160;a new century approaches and the djinn gather within&amp;#160;Daevabad\'s towering brass walls&amp;#160;for celebrations, a threat brews unseen in the desolate north. It&rsquo;s a force that would bring a storm of fire straight to the city&rsquo;s&amp;#160;gates . . . and&amp;#160;one that seeks the aid of a warrior trapped between worlds, torn between a violent duty he can never escape and a peace he fears he will never deserve."/>\n\t\n    \n\t<title>Listen to Kingdom of Copper: A Novel by S.              </div>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                                                                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/181641/s-a-chakraborty">S. A. Chakraborty</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/27119/soneela-nankani">Soneela Nankani</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">HarperAudio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">January 2019</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">23 hours 15 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">S. A. Chakraborty continues the sweeping adventure begun in&#160;The City of Brass\xe2\x80\x94\'the best adult fantasy I\xe2\x80\x99ve read since&#160;The Name of the Wind\' (#1&#160;New York Times&#160;bestselling author Sabaa Tahir)\xe2\x80\x94conjuring a world where djinn summon flames with the snap of a finger and waters run deep with old magic; where blood can be dangerous as any spell, and a clever con artist from Cairo will alter the fate of a kingdom.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nNahri\xe2\x80\x99s life changed forever the moment she accidentally summoned Dara, a formidable, mysterious djinn, during one of her schemes. Whisked from her home in Cairo, she was thrust into the dazzling royal court of Daevabad\xe2\x80\x94and quickly discovered she would need all her grifter instincts to survive there. <br />\r\n<br />\r\nNow, with Daevabad entrenched in the dark aftermath of a devastating battle, Nahri must forge a new path for herself. But even as she embraces her heritage and the power it holds, she knows she\xe2\x80\x99s been trapped in a gilded cage, watched by a king who rules from the throne that once belonged to her family\xe2\x80\x94and one misstep will doom her tribe..<br />\r\n<br />\r\nMeanwhile, Ali has been exiled for daring to defy his father. Hunted by assassins, adrift on the unforgiving copper sands of his&#160;ancestral land, he is forced to rely on the frightening abilities the marid\xe2\x80\x94the unpredictable water spirits\xe2\x80\x94have gifted him. But in doing so, he threatens to unearth a terrible secret his family has long kept buried.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nAnd as&#160;a new century approaches and the djinn gather within&#160;Daevabad\'s towering brass walls&#160;for celebrations, a threat brews unseen in the desolate north. It\xe2\x80\x99s a force that would bring a storm of fire straight to the city\xe2\x80\x99s&#160;gates . . . and&#160;one that seeks the aid of a warrior trapped between worlds, torn between a violent duty he can never escape and a peace he fears he will never deserve.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/fiction_and_literature" genre-id="15"><span itemprop="title">Fiction & Literature</split></a> &gt; brought to life a dazzling world in The Sword of Shannara. Nineteen more Shannara volumes would follow, making the series one of the most popular fantasy epics of all time. Now comes a fully annotated collector’s edition of the novel that started it all—featuring never-before-shared insights into the classic tale, an all-new introduction by the New York Times bestselling author, and replicas of the original sketches for some of the long-lost, black-and-white paintings by the Brothers Hildebrandt that decorated the original edition, and a replica of the original Hildebrandt central color plate on the back of the jacket.. \xa0 Long ago, wars ravaged the world. In peaceful Shady Vale, half-elfin Shea Ohmsford knows little of such troubles. Then the giant, forbidding Allanon reveals that the supposedly dead Warlock Lord is plotting to destroy everything in his wake. The sole weapon against this Power of Darkness is the Sword of Shannara, which can be used only by a true heir of Shannara. On Shea, last of the bloodline, rests the hope of all the races.  \xa0 Soon a Skull Bearer, dread minion of a mighty evil, flies into the Vale, seeking to destroy Shea. To save his home, Shea must flee, drawing the Skull Bearer after him in menacing pursuit. \xa0 Thus begins the enthralling Shannara epic, a spellbinding tale of adventure, magic, and myth. \xa0 PRAISE FOR TERRY BROOKS \xa0 “The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks’s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy. This was one of my favorite fictional worlds growing up, and I look forward to many return trips.”—Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia! “Terry Brooks has been my constant companion over a lifetime of exploring my beloved fantasy genre. Nineteen more Shannara volumes would follow, making the series one of the most popular fantasy epics of all time. Now comes a fully annotated collector&amp;rsquo;s edition of the novel that started it all&amp;mdash;featuring never-before-shared insights into the classic tale, an all-new introduction by the New York Times bestselling author, and replicas of the original sketches for some of the long-lost, black-and-white paintings by the Brothers Hildebrandt that decorated the original edition, and a replica of the original Hildebrandt central color plate on the back of the jacket..&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Long ago, wars ravaged the world. In peaceful Shady Vale, half-elfin Shea Ohmsford knows little of such troubles. Then the giant, forbidding Allanon reveals that the supposedly dead Warlock Lord is plotting to destroy everything in his wake. The sole weapon against this Power of Darkness is the Sword of Shannara, which can be used only by a true heir of Shannara. On Shea, last of the bloodline, rests the hope of all the races. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Soon a Skull Bearer, dread minion of a mighty evil, flies into the Vale, seeking to destroy Shea. To save his home, Shea must flee, drawing the Skull Bearer after him in menacing pursuit.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Thus begins the enthralling Shannara epic, a spellbinding tale of adventure, magic, and myth.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n PRAISE FOR TERRY BROOKS&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy. This was one of my favorite fictional worlds growing up, and I look forward to many return trips.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;Terry Brooks has been my constant companion over a lifetime of exploring my beloved fantasy genre. I say with all honesty I would not be writing epic fantasy today if not for Shannara. If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;I can&amp;rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s books I&amp;rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. Not only do I owe him for many hours of reading pleasure, I owe him my job. He is required reading.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;The Shannara books were among the first to really capture my imagination. I didn&amp;rsquo;t just enjoy reading the novels&amp;mdash;the world became so real that I would spend hours creating Shannara fan-fiction in my mind. My daydreams and therefore my stories will always owe a debt to Terry Brooks.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Brandon Mull, #1 New York Times bestselling author of the Beyonders and Fablehaven series"/>\n\t\n      </div>\r\n                                                                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/664/terry-brooks">Terry Brooks</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/1115/scott-brick">Scott Brick</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">November 2012</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">27 hours 31 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">THE PHENOMENAL EPIC OF GOOD AND EVIL LIKE IT&rsquo;S NEVER BEEN EXPERIENCED BEFORE<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Thirty-five years ago, Terry Brooks brought to life a dazzling world in The Sword of Shannara. Nineteen more Shannara volumes would follow, making the series one of the most popular fantasy epics of all time. Now comes a fully annotated collector&rsquo;s edition of the novel that started it all&mdash;featuring never-before-shared insights into the classic tale, an all-new introduction by the New York Times bestselling author, and replicas of the original sketches for some of the long-lost, black-and-white paintings by the Brothers Hildebrandt that decorated the original edition, and a replica of the original Hildebrandt central color plate on the back of the jacket..<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Long ago, wars ravaged the world. In peaceful Shady Vale, half-elfin Shea Ohmsford knows little of such troubles. Then the giant, forbidding Allanon reveals that the supposedly dead Warlock Lord is plotting to destroy everything in his wake. The sole weapon against this Power of Darkness is the Sword of Shannara, which can be used only by a true heir of Shannara. On Shea, last of the bloodline, rests the hope of all the races. <br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Soon a Skull Bearer, dread minion of a mighty evil, flies into the Vale, seeking to destroy Shea. To save his home, Shea must flee, drawing the Skull Bearer after him in menacing pursuit.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Thus begins the enthralling Shannara epic, a spellbinding tale of adventure, magic, and myth.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n PRAISE FOR TERRY BROOKS<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n&ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy. This was one of my favorite fictional worlds growing up, and I look forward to many return trips.&rdquo;&mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;Terry Brooks has been my constant companion over a lifetime of exploring my beloved fantasy genre. I say with all honesty I would not be writing epic fantasy today if not for Shannara. If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&rdquo;&mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;I can&rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s books I&rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&rdquo;&mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. Not only do I owe him for many hours of reading pleasure, I owe him my job. He is required reading.&rdquo;&mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Shannara books were among the first to really capture my imagination. I didn&rsquo;t just enjoy reading the novels&mdash;the world became so real that I would spend hours creating Shannara fan-fiction in my mind. My daydreams and therefore my stories will always owe a debt to Terry Brooks.&rdquo;&mdash;Brandon Mull, #1 New York Times bestselling author of the Beyonders and Fablehaven series</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy" genre-id="1"><span itemprop="title">Science Fiction & Fantasy</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy/fantasy" genre-id="2"><span itemprop="title">Fantasy</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div True, None], 55.5], [['AUDIOBOOK', 'The Annotated Sword of Shannara: 35th Anniversary Edition', <PIL.Image.Image image mode=L size=344x403 at 0x17DDF13D408>, 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9780449013359.jpg', None, 'THE PHENOMENAL EPIC OF GOOD AND EVIL LIKE IT’S NEVER BEEN EXPERIENCED BEFORE \xa0 Thirty-five years ago, Terry Brooks brought to life a dazzling world in The Sword of Shannara. Nineteen more Shannara volumes would follow, making the series one of the most popular fantasy epics of all time. Now comes a fully annotated collector’s edition of the novel that started it all—featuring never-before-shared insights into the classic tale, an all-new introduction by the New York Times bestselling author, and replicas of the original sketches for some of the long-lost, black-and-white paintings by the Brothers Hildebrandt that decorated the original edition, and a replica of the original Hildebrandt central color plate on the back of the jacket.. \xa0 Long ago, wars ravaged the world. In peaceful Shady Vale, half-elfin Shea Ohmsford knows little of such troubles. Then the giant, forbidding Allanon reveals that the supposedly dead Warlock Lord is plotting to destroy everything in his wake. The sole weapon against this Power of Darkness is the Sword of Shannara, which can be used only by a true heir of Shannara. On Shea, last of the bloodline, rests the hope of all the races.  \xa0 Soon a Skull Bearer, dread minion of a mighty evil, flies into the Vale, seeking to destroy Shea. To save his home, Shea must flee, drawing the Skull Bearer after him in menacing pursuit. \xa0 Thus begins the enthralling Shannara epic, a spellbinding tale of adventure, magic, and myth. \xa0 PRAISE FOR TERRY BROOKS \xa0 “The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks’s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy. This was one of my favorite fictional worlds growing up, and I look forward to many return trips.”—Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia! “Terry Brooks has been my constant companion over a lifetime of exploring my beloved fantasy genre. I say with all honesty I would not be writing epic fantasy today if not for Shannara. If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.”—Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear \xa0 “I can’t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks’s books I’ve read (and reread) over the years. Nineteen more Shannara volumes would follow, making the series one of the most popular fantasy epics of all time. Now comes a fully annotated collector&amp;rsquo;s edition of the novel that started it all&amp;mdash;featuring never-before-shared insights into the classic tale, an all-new introduction by the New York Times bestselling author, and replicas of the original sketches for some of the long-lost, black-and-white paintings by the Brothers Hildebrandt that decorated the original edition, and a replica of the original Hildebrandt central color plate on the back of the jacket..&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Long ago, wars ravaged the world. In peaceful Shady Vale, half-elfin Shea Ohmsford knows little of such troubles. Then the giant, forbidding Allanon reveals that the supposedly dead Warlock Lord is plotting to destroy everything in his wake. The sole weapon against this Power of Darkness is the Sword of Shannara, which can be used only by a true heir of Shannara. On Shea, last of the bloodline, rests the hope of all the races. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Soon a Skull Bearer, dread minion of a mighty evil, flies into the Vale, seeking to destroy Shea. To save his home, Shea must flee, drawing the Skull Bearer after him in menacing pursuit.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Thus begins the enthralling Shannara epic, a spellbinding tale of adventure, magic, and myth.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n PRAISE FOR TERRY BROOKS&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy. This was one of my favorite fictional worlds growing up, and I look forward to many return trips.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;Terry Brooks has been my constant companion over a lifetime of exploring my beloved fantasy genre. I say with all honesty I would not be writing epic fantasy today if not for Shannara. If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;I can&amp;rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s books I&amp;rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. Not only do I owe him for many hours of reading pleasure, I owe him my job. He is required reading.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;The Shannara books were among the first to really capture my imagination. I didn&amp;rsquo;t just enjoy reading the novels&amp;mdash;the world became so real that I would spend hours creating Shannara fan-fiction in my mind. My daydreams and therefore my stories will always owe a debt to Terry Brooks.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Brandon Mull, #1 New York Times bestselling author of the Beyonders and Fablehaven series"/>\n\t\n      </div>\r\n                                                                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/664/terry-brooks">Terry Brooks</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/1115/scott-brick">Scott Brick</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">November 2012</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">27 hours 31 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">THE PHENOMENAL EPIC OF GOOD AND EVIL LIKE IT&rsquo;S NEVER BEEN EXPERIENCED BEFORE<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Thirty-five years ago, Terry Brooks brought to life a dazzling world in The Sword of Shannara. Nineteen more Shannara volumes would follow, making the series one of the most popular fantasy epics of all time. Now comes a fully annotated collector&rsquo;s edition of the novel that started it all&mdash;featuring never-before-shared insights into the classic tale, an all-new introduction by the New York Times bestselling author, and replicas of the original sketches for some of the long-lost, black-and-white paintings by the Brothers Hildebrandt that decorated the original edition, and a replica of the original Hildebrandt central color plate on the back of the jacket..<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Long ago, wars ravaged the world. In peaceful Shady Vale, half-elfin Shea Ohmsford knows little of such troubles. Then the giant, forbidding Allanon reveals that the supposedly dead Warlock Lord is plotting to destroy everything in his wake. The sole weapon against this Power of Darkness is the Sword of Shannara, which can be used only by a true heir of Shannara. On Shea, last of the bloodline, rests the hope of all the races. <br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Soon a Skull Bearer, dread minion of a mighty evil, flies into the Vale, seeking to destroy Shea. To save his home, Shea must flee, drawing the Skull Bearer after him in menacing pursuit.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Thus begins the enthralling Shannara epic, a spellbinding tale of adventure, magic, and myth.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n PRAISE FOR TERRY BROOKS<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n&ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy. This was one of my favorite fictional worlds growing up, and I look forward to many return trips.&rdquo;&mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;Terry Brooks has been my constant companion over a lifetime of exploring my beloved fantasy genre. I say with all honesty I would not be writing epic fantasy today if not for Shannara. If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&rdquo;&mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;I can&rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s books I&rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&rdquo;&mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. Not only do I owe him for many hours of reading pleasure, I owe him my job. He is required reading.&rdquo;&mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Shannara books were among the first to really capture my imagination. I didn&rsquo;t just enjoy reading the novels&mdash;the world became so real that I would spend hours creating Shannara fan-fiction in my mind. My daydreams and therefore my stories will always owe a debt to Terry Brooks.&rdquo;&mdash;Brandon Mull, #1 New York Times bestselling author of the Beyonders and Fablehaven series</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy" genre-id="1"><span itemprop="title">Science Fiction & Fantasy</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy/fantasy" genre-id="2"><span itemprop="title">Fantasy</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div class="line"></div>\r\n\r\n                    <!-- Similar Titles and Also Customers Bought Tab Widget -->\r\n                    <div class="tab_widget" id="book-details-similar-titles-tab">\r\n                        <ul class="tabs">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="active"><a href="#tab-similar" data-href="#tab-similar">Similar Titles</a></li>\r\n                        </ul>\r\n                 <div id="tab-reviews" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: block;">\r\n                                <ul class="sposts-list clearfix">\r\n                                                                    \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div                                          <h5 class="nopadding">Ryan Ten Eyck</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="5"></span>\r\n class="book-rating-description nomargin">The authors comments were interesting and added more context to the story, but it did give info away for those who have not read the series before.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Meredith Kellahan</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="4"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">Whilst at first I found the annotations a jarring concept to the flow of the book I became used to it then it became an interesting part of the book.\nThe narrator has a very smooth voice and good way of holding your interest </p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Monica Stark</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="2"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">I didn\'t realize until after I\'d paid for this book that the annotations are in line. I find the interruptions by the author very jarring and distracting. Would not have bought this if I had known.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                </ul>\r\n                            </div>\r\n                            <div id="tab-social" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: none;">Donec in tortor in lectus iaculis vulputate. Sed aliquam, urna ut sollicitudin molestie, lacus justo aliquam mauris, interdum aliquam sapien nisi cursus mauris. Nunc hendrerit tortor vitae est placerat ut varius erat posuere. Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper. But now the unthinkable is happening: The ancient wards securing the barrier between order and mayhem have begun to erode&amp;mdash;and generations of bloodthirsty, monstrous creatures, fueled by a rage thousands of years in the making, are poised to spill forth, seeking revenge for what was done to them.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Young Elf Arling Elessedil possesses the enchanted means to close the breach and once more seal the denizens of the Forbidding in their prison. But when she falls into the hands of the powerful Federation&amp;rsquo;s diabolical Prime Minister, her efforts may be doomed. Only her determined sister, Aphen, who bears the Elfstones and commands their magic, has any hope of saving Arling from the hideous fate her captor has in store.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Meanwhile, Railing Ohmsford&amp;mdash;desperate to save his imprisoned brother&amp;mdash;seeks to discover if his famed but ill-fated ancestor Grianne is still alive and willing to help him save the world . . . no matter the odds or the consequences.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nPraise for Witch Wraith&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Terry Brooks has written a slam-bang conclusion to his The Dark Legacy of Shannara trilogy with the stellar Witch Wraith. . . . He has a keen eye for great world-building as well as unforgettable characters. . . . The Dark Legacy of Shannara trilogy is arguably his best work to date.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Associated Press&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;The final chapter in Brooks&amp;rsquo;s latest trilogy set in his beloved world of Shannara peaks in a bittersweet conclusion that seems to set the stage for future books. A must for the numerous die-hard Shannara fans.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Library Journal&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nPraise for Terry Brooks&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;I can&amp;rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s books I&amp;rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. He is required reading.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;The Shannara books were among the first to really capture my imagination. My daydreams and therefore my stories will always owe a debt to Terry Brooks.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Brandon Mull, #1 New York Times bestselling author of the Beyonders and Fablehaven series"/>\n\t\n                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/664/terry-brooks">Terry Brooks</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/7252/rosalyn-landor">Rosalyn Landor</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">July 2013</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">15 hours 41 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">From bestselling author Terry Brooks comes the final thrilling novel in the Dark Legacy of Shannara trilogy!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\nNEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER<br />\r\n<br />\r\nFor centuries the Four Lands enjoyed freedom from its demon-haunted past, protected by magic-enhanced borders from the dark dimension known as the Forbidding and the profound evil imprisoned there. But now the unthinkable is happening: The ancient wards securing the barrier between order and mayhem have begun to erode&mdash;and generations of bloodthirsty, monstrous creatures, fueled by a rage thousands of years in the making, are poised to spill forth, seeking revenge for what was done to them.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Young Elf Arling Elessedil possesses the enchanted means to close the breach and once more seal the denizens of the Forbidding in their prison. But when she falls into the hands of the powerful Federation&rsquo;s diabolical Prime Minister, her efforts may be doomed. Only her determined sister, Aphen, who bears the Elfstones and commands their magic, has any hope of saving Arling from the hideous fate her captor has in store.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Meanwhile, Railing Ohmsford&mdash;desperate to save his imprisoned brother&mdash;seeks to discover if his famed but ill-fated ancestor Grianne is still alive and willing to help him save the world . . . no matter the odds or the consequences.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for Witch Wraith<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks has written a slam-bang conclusion to his The Dark Legacy of Shannara trilogy with the stellar Witch Wraith. . . . He has a keen eye for great world-building as well as unforgettable characters. . . . The Dark Legacy of Shannara trilogy is arguably his best work to date.&rdquo;&mdash;Associated Press<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The final chapter in Brooks&rsquo;s latest trilogy set in his beloved world of Shannara peaks in a bittersweet conclusion that seems to set the stage for future books. A must for the numerous die-hard Shannara fans.&rdquo;&mdash;Library Journal<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for Terry Brooks<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.&rdquo;&mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&rdquo;&mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;I can&rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s books I&rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&rdquo;&mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. He is required reading.&rdquo;&mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Shannara books were among the first to really capture my imagination. My daydreams and therefore my stories will always owe a debt to Terry Brooks.&rdquo;&mdash;Brandon Mull, #1 New York Times bestselling author of the Beyonders and Fablehaven series</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a But now the unthinkable is happening: The ancient wards securing the barrier between order and mayhem have begun to erode&amp;mdash;and generations of bloodthirsty, monstrous creatures, fueled by a rage thousands of years in the making, are poised to spill forth, seeking revenge for what was done to them.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Young Elf Arling Elessedil possesses the enchanted means to close the breach and once more seal the denizens of the Forbidding in their prison.
