                                                                  <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/664/terry-brooks">Terry Brooks</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/7252/rosalyn-landor">Rosalyn Landor</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">July 2013</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">15 hours 41 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">From bestselling author Terry Brooks comes the final thrilling novel in the Dark Legacy of Shannara trilogy!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\nNEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER<br />\r\n<br />\r\nFor centuries the Four Lands enjoyed freedom from its demon-haunted past, protected by magic-enhanced borders from the dark dimension known as the Forbidding and the profound evil imprisoned there. But now the unthinkable is happening: The ancient wards securing the barrier between order and mayhem have begun to erode&mdash;and generations of bloodthirsty, monstrous creatures, fueled by a rage thousands of years in the making, are poised to spill forth, seeking revenge for what was done to them.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Young Elf Arling Elessedil possesses the enchanted means to close the breach and once more seal the denizens of the Forbidding in their prison. But when she falls into the hands of the powerful Federation&rsquo;s diabolical Prime Minister, her efforts may be doomed. Only her determined sister, Aphen, who bears the Elfstones and commands their magic, has any hope of saving Arling from the hideous fate her captor has in store.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Meanwhile, Railing Ohmsford&mdash;desperate to save his imprisoned brother&mdash;seeks to discover if his famed but ill-fated ancestor Grianne is still alive and willing to help him save the world . . . no matter the odds or the consequences.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for Witch Wraith<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks has written a slam-bang conclusion to his The Dark Legacy of Shannara trilogy with the stellar Witch Wraith. . . . He has a keen eye for great world-building as well as unforgettable characters. . . . The Dark Legacy of Shannara trilogy is arguably his best work to date.&rdquo;&mdash;Associated Press<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The final chapter in Brooks&rsquo;s latest trilogy set in his beloved world of Shannara peaks in a bittersweet conclusion that seems to set the stage for future books. A must for the numerous die-hard Shannara fans.&rdquo;&mdash;Library Journal<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for Terry Brooks<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.&rdquo;&mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&rdquo;&mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;I can&rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s books I&rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&rdquo;&mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. He is required reading.&rdquo;&mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Shannara books were among the first to really capture my imagination. My daydreams and therefore my stories will always owe a debt to Terry Brooks.&rdquo;&mdash;Brandon Mull, #1 New York Times bestselling author of the Beyonders and Fablehaven series</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy" genre-id="1"><span itemprop="title">Science Fiction & Fantasy</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy/fantasy" genre-id="2"><span itemprop="title">Fantasy</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9780804190688.jpg', None, 'From New York Times bestselling author Terry Brooks comes a thrilling stand-alone novel in his legendary Shannara series—the perfect place for new readers to begin. After taking up his enchanted sword against the dark sorcerer Arcannen, Paxon Leah has become the sworn protector of the Druid order. Now a critical hour is at hand, as a beloved High Druid nears the end of her reign and prepares to pass from the mortal world to the one beyond. There is little time for Paxon to mourn his friend and benefactor before duty summons him. For in a distant corner of the Four Lands, the magic of the wishsong has been detected. Paxon must accompany a Druid emissary to find its source—and ensure the formidable power is not wielded by the wrong hands. \xa0 But danger is already afoot in the village of Portlow. Gentle traveling minstrel Reyn Frosch possesses the uncanny gift, and curse, of the wishsong. And now his coveted abilities have captured the malevolent interest of none other than Arcannen—whose quest for power is exceeded only by his thirst for vengeance. The lone survivor of a brutal assault on a notorious pirate city, the sorcerer is determined to retaliate against the Federation’s elite military guard—and use the devastating power of the wishsong as his ultimate weapon. Praise for The Darkling Child \xa0 “Brimming with magic . . . a bubbling cauldron of fantasy and intrigue. This novel shines best through a full-bodied embrace of its most wildly imaginative magic and artifice, which is careful not to overshadow the story’s greater half, fueled by a complex but well-constructed manifold of motives. The intrigue, grounded in a world that strays just enough from a traditional fantasy universe to elicit delighted curiosity, guarantees a solid fantasy read, especially for those already drawn into Brooks’s vast world of Shannara.”—Booklist \xa0 “Brooks’s fans and those who prefer their fantasy on a smaller scale will appreciate the more personal but still high-stakes turn in this famous world.”—Publishers Weekly \xa0 Praise for Terry Brooks \xa0 “The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks’s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.”—Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia! \xa0 “If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.”—Peter V. Now a critical hour is at hand, as a beloved High Druid nears the end of her reign and prepares to pass from the mortal world to the one beyond. There is little time for Paxon to mourn his friend and benefactor before duty summons him. For in a distant corner of the Four Lands, the magic of the wishsong has been detected. Paxon must accompany a Druid emissary to find its source&amp;mdash;and ensure the formidable power is not wielded by the wrong hands.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n But danger is already afoot in the village of Portlow. Gentle traveling minstrel Reyn Frosch possesses the uncanny gift, and curse, of the wishsong. And now his coveted abilities have captured the malevolent interest of none other than Arcannen&amp;mdash;whose quest for power is exceeded only by his thirst for vengeance. The lone survivor of a brutal assault on a notorious pirate city, the sorcerer is determined to retaliate against the Federation&amp;rsquo;s elite military guard&amp;mdash;and use the devastating power of the wishsong as his ultimate weapon.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nPraise for The Darkling Child&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Brimming with magic . . . a bubbling cauldron of fantasy and intrigue. This novel shines best through a full-bodied embrace of its most wildly imaginative magic and artifice, which is careful not to overshadow the story&amp;rsquo;s greater half, fueled by a complex but well-constructed manifold of motives. The intrigue, grounded in a world that strays just enough from a traditional fantasy universe to elicit delighted curiosity, guarantees a solid fantasy read, especially for those already drawn into Brooks&amp;rsquo;s vast world of Shannara.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Booklist&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Brooks&amp;rsquo;s fans and those who prefer their fantasy on a smaller scale will appreciate the more personal but still high-stakes turn in this famous world.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Publishers Weekly&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Praise for Terry Brooks&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;I can&amp;rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s books I&amp;rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. He is required reading.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;The Shannara books were among the first to really capture my imagination. My daydreams and therefore my stories will always owe a debt to Terry Brooks.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Brandon Mull, #1 New York Times bestselling author of the Beyonders and Fablehaven series"/>\n\t\n                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/664/terry-brooks">Terry Brooks</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/1170/simon-vance">Simon Vance</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">June 2015</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">10 hours 3 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">From New York Times bestselling author Terry Brooks comes a thrilling stand-alone novel in his legendary Shannara series&mdash;the perfect place for new readers to begin.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nAfter taking up his enchanted sword against the dark sorcerer Arcannen, Paxon Leah has become the sworn protector of the Druid order. Now a critical hour is at hand, as a beloved High Druid nears the end of her reign and prepares to pass from the mortal world to the one beyond. There is little time for Paxon to mourn his friend and benefactor before duty summons him. For in a distant corner of the Four Lands, the magic of the wishsong has been detected. Paxon must accompany a Druid emissary to find its source&mdash;and ensure the formidable power is not wielded by the wrong hands.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n But danger is already afoot in the village of Portlow. Gentle traveling minstrel Reyn Frosch possesses the uncanny gift, and curse, of the wishsong. And now his coveted abilities have captured the malevolent interest of none other than Arcannen&mdash;whose quest for power is exceeded only by his thirst for vengeance. The lone survivor of a brutal assault on a notorious pirate city, the sorcerer is determined to retaliate against the Federation&rsquo;s elite military guard&mdash;and use the devastating power of the wishsong as his ultimate weapon.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for The Darkling Child<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Brimming with magic . . . a bubbling cauldron of fantasy and intrigue. This novel shines best through a full-bodied embrace of its most wildly imaginative magic and artifice, which is careful not to overshadow the story&rsquo;s greater half, fueled by a complex but well-constructed manifold of motives. The intrigue, grounded in a world that strays just enough from a traditional fantasy universe to elicit delighted curiosity, guarantees a solid fantasy read, especially for those already drawn into Brooks&rsquo;s vast world of Shannara.&rdquo;&mdash;Booklist<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Brooks&rsquo;s fans and those who prefer their fantasy on a smaller scale will appreciate the more personal but still high-stakes turn in this famous world.&rdquo;&mdash;Publishers Weekly<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for Terry Brooks<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.&rdquo;&mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&rdquo;&mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;I can&rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s books I&rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&rdquo;&mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. He is required reading.&rdquo;&mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Shannara books were among the first to really capture my imagination. My daydreams and therefore my stories will always owe a debt to Terry Brooks.&rdquo;&mdash;Brandon Mull, #1 New York Times bestselling author of the Beyonders and Fablehaven series</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9780804190688.jpg', None, 'From New York Times bestselling author Terry Brooks comes a thrilling stand-alone novel in his legendary Shannara series—the perfect place for new readers to begin. After taking up his enchanted sword against the dark sorcerer Arcannen, Paxon Leah has become the sworn protector of the Druid order. Now a critical hour is at hand, as a beloved High Druid nears the end of her reign and prepares to pass from the mortal world to the one beyond. There is little time for Paxon to mourn his friend and benefactor before duty summons him. For in a distant corner of the Four Lands, the magic of the wishsong has been detected. Paxon must accompany a Druid emissary to find its source—and ensure the formidable power is not wielded by the wrong hands. \xa0 But danger is already afoot in the village of Portlow. Gentle traveling minstrel Reyn Frosch possesses the uncanny gift, and curse, of the wishsong. And now his coveted abilities have captured the malevolent interest of none other than Arcannen—whose quest for power is exceeded only by his thirst for vengeance. The lone survivor of a brutal assault on a notorious pirate city, the sorcerer is determined to retaliate against the Federation’s elite military guard—and use the devastating power of the wishsong as his ultimate weapon. Praise for The Darkling Child \xa0 “Brimming with magic . . . a bubbling cauldron of fantasy and intrigue. This novel shines best through a full-bodied embrace of its most wildly imaginative magic and artifice, which is careful not to overshadow the story’s greater half, fueled by a complex but well-constructed manifold of motives. The intrigue, grounded in a world that strays just enough from a traditional fantasy universe to elicit delighted curiosity, guarantees a solid fantasy read, especially for those already drawn into Brooks’s vast world of Shannara.”—Booklist \xa0 “Brooks’s fans and those who prefer their fantasy on a smaller scale will appreciate the more personal but still high-stakes turn in this famous world.”—Publishers Weekly \xa0 Praise for Terry Brooks \xa0 “The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks’s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.”—Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia! \xa0 “If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.”—Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear \xa0 “I can’t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks’s books I’ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.”—Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind \xa0 “Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. He is required reading.”—Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy \xa0 “The Shannara books were among the first to really capture my imagination. Now a critical hour is at hand, as a beloved High Druid nears the end of her reign and prepares to pass from the mortal world to the one beyond. There is little time for Paxon to mourn his friend and benefactor before duty summons him. For in a distant corner of the Four Lands, the magic of the wishsong has been detected. Paxon must accompany a Druid emissary to find its source&amp;mdash;and ensure the formidable power is not wielded by the wrong hands.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n But danger is already afoot in the village of Portlow. Gentle traveling minstrel Reyn Frosch possesses the uncanny gift, and curse, of the wishsong. And now his coveted abilities have captured the malevolent interest of none other than Arcannen&amp;mdash;whose quest for power is exceeded only by his thirst for vengeance. The lone survivor of a brutal assault on a notorious pirate city, the sorcerer is determined to retaliate against the Federation&amp;rsquo;s elite military guard&amp;mdash;and use the devastating power of the wishsong as his ultimate weapon.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nPraise for The Darkling Child&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Brimming with magic . . . a bubbling cauldron of fantasy and intrigue. This novel shines best through a full-bodied embrace of its most wildly imaginative magic and artifice, which is careful not to overshadow the story&amp;rsquo;s greater half, fueled by a complex but well-constructed manifold of motives. The intrigue, grounded in a world that strays just enough from a traditional fantasy universe to elicit delighted curiosity, guarantees a solid fantasy read, especially for those already drawn into Brooks&amp;rsquo;s vast world of Shannara.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Booklist&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Brooks&amp;rsquo;s fans and those who prefer their fantasy on a smaller scale will appreciate the more personal but still high-stakes turn in this famous world.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Publishers Weekly&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Praise for Terry Brooks&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Peter V. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre.                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/664/terry-brooks">Terry Brooks</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/1170/simon-vance">Simon Vance</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">June 2015</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">10 hours 3 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">From New York Times bestselling author Terry Brooks comes a thrilling stand-alone novel in his legendary Shannara series&mdash;the perfect place for new readers to begin.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nAfter taking up his enchanted sword against the dark sorcerer Arcannen, Paxon Leah has become the sworn protector of the Druid order. Now a critical hour is at hand, as a beloved High Druid nears the end of her reign and prepares to pass from the mortal world to the one beyond. There is little time for Paxon to mourn his friend and benefactor before duty summons him. For in a distant corner of the Four Lands, the magic of the wishsong has been detected. Paxon must accompany a Druid emissary to find its source&mdash;and ensure the formidable power is not wielded by the wrong hands.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n But danger is already afoot in the village of Portlow. Gentle traveling minstrel Reyn Frosch possesses the uncanny gift, and curse, of the wishsong. And now his coveted abilities have captured the malevolent interest of none other than Arcannen&mdash;whose quest for power is exceeded only by his thirst for vengeance. The lone survivor of a brutal assault on a notorious pirate city, the sorcerer is determined to retaliate against the Federation&rsquo;s elite military guard&mdash;and use the devastating power of the wishsong as his ultimate weapon.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for The Darkling Child<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Brimming with magic . . . a bubbling cauldron of fantasy and intrigue. This novel shines best through a full-bodied embrace of its most wildly imaginative magic and artifice, which is careful not to overshadow the story&rsquo;s greater half, fueled by a complex but well-constructed manifold of motives. The intrigue, grounded in a world that strays just enough from a traditional fantasy universe to elicit delighted curiosity, guarantees a solid fantasy read, especially for those already drawn into Brooks&rsquo;s vast world of Shannara.&rdquo;&mdash;Booklist<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Brooks&rsquo;s fans and those who prefer their fantasy on a smaller scale will appreciate the more personal but still high-stakes turn in this famous world.&rdquo;&mdash;Publishers Weekly<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for Terry Brooks<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.&rdquo;&mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&rdquo;&mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;I can&rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s books I&rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&rdquo;&mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. He is required reading.&rdquo;&mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Shannara books were among the first to really capture my imagination. My daydreams and therefore my stories will always owe a debt to Terry Brooks.&rdquo;&mdash;Brandon Mull, #1 New York Times bestselling author of the Beyonders and Fablehaven series</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a Highlands and waged war with magical weapons. But those kings, queens, and heroes are long gone, and there is nothing enchanted about the antique sword that hangs above Paxon’s fireplace. Running his family’s modest shipping business, Paxon leads a quiet life—until extraordinary circumstances overturn his simple world . . . and rewrite his destiny. \xa0 When his brash young sister is abducted by a menacing stranger, Paxon races to her rescue with the only weapon he can find. And in a harrowing duel, he is stunned to discover powerful magic unleashed within him—and within his ancestors’ ancient blade. But his formidable new ability is dangerous in untrained hands, and Paxon must master it quickly because his nearly fatal clash with the dark sorcerer Arcannen won’t be his last. Leaving behind home and hearth, he journeys to the keep of the fabled Druid order to learn the secrets of magic and earn the right to become their sworn protector. \xa0 But treachery is afoot deep in the Druids’ ranks. And the blackest of sorcery is twisting a helpless innocent into a murderous agent of evil. To halt an insidious plot that threatens not only the Druid order but all the Four Lands, Paxon Leah must summon the profound magic in his blood and the legendary mettle of his elders in the battle fate has chosen him to fight. But those kings, queens, and heroes are long gone, and there is nothing enchanted about the antique sword that hangs above Paxon&amp;rsquo;s fireplace. Running his family&amp;rsquo;s modest shipping business, Paxon leads a quiet life&amp;mdash;until extraordinary circumstances overturn his simple world . . . and rewrite his destiny.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n When his brash young sister is abducted by a menacing stranger, Paxon races to her rescue with the only weapon he can find. And in a harrowing duel, he is stunned to discover powerful magic unleashed within him&amp;mdash;and within his ancestors&amp;rsquo; ancient blade. But his formidable new ability is dangerous in untrained hands, and Paxon must master it quickly because his nearly fatal clash with the dark sorcerer Arcannen won&amp;rsquo;t be his last. Leaving behind home and hearth, he journeys to the keep of the fabled Druid order to learn the secrets of magic and earn the right to become their sworn protector.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n But treachery is afoot deep in the Druids&amp;rsquo; ranks. class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/1170/simon-vance">Simon Vance</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">July 2014</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">10 hours 20 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER<br />\r\n<br />\r\nLegend has it that Paxon Leah is descended from the royals and warriors who once ruled the Highlands and waged war with magical weapons. But those kings, queens, and heroes are long gone, and there is nothing enchanted about the antique sword that hangs above Paxon&rsquo;s fireplace. Running his family&rsquo;s modest shipping business, Paxon leads a quiet life&mdash;until extraordinary circumstances overturn his simple world . . . and rewrite his destiny.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n When his brash young sister is abducted by a menacing stranger, Paxon races to her rescue with the only weapon he can find. And in a harrowing duel, he is stunned to discover powerful magic unleashed within him&mdash;and within his ancestors&rsquo; ancient blade. But his formidable new ability is dangerous in untrained hands, and Paxon must master it quickly because his nearly fatal clash with the dark sorcerer Arcannen won&rsquo;t be his last. Leaving behind home and hearth, he journeys to the keep of the fabled Druid order to learn the secrets of magic and earn the right to become their sworn protector.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n But treachery is afoot deep in the Druids&rsquo; ranks. And the blackest of sorcery is twisting a helpless innocent into a murderous agent of evil. To halt an insidious plot that threatens not only the Druid order but all the Four Lands, Paxon Leah must summon the profound magic in his blood and the legendary mettle of his elders in the battle fate has chosen him to fight.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for The High Druid&rsquo;s Blade<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n&ldquo;High adventure, lots of action, and appealing [characters] . . . a good place for new readers to jump into the author\'s world.&rdquo;&mdash;Library Journal<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;Terry Brooks is a grandmaster of the fantasy genre, and his latest will both captivate and surprise readers. . . . It&rsquo;s truly magical.&rdquo;&mdash;Associated Press<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Brooks once again gifts readers with a breathless adventure in this new Shannara trilogy, the Defenders of Shannara. The action begins in the first chapter and doesn&rsquo;t end until the last page.&rdquo;&mdash;RT Book Reviews<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;A great place to introduce yourself to all of Brooks&rsquo;s novels . . . [The High Druid&rsquo;s Blade] is a great stand-alone book and will definitely throw you headfirst into the world of Shannara.&rdquo;&mdash;Whedonopolis<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The High Druid\'s Blade is an intriguing, action-filled novel that you are sure to love.&rdquo;&mdash;Faire&rsquo;s Fair Book Reviews<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Readers both new [and old] will enjoy reading The High Druid&rsquo;s Blade.&rdquo;&mdash;The Arched Doorway<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;An enjoyable read . . . I will definitely be picking up the next book when it comes out.&rdquo;&mdash;Jessie Reads Everything<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for Terry Brooks<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.&rdquo;&mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&rdquo;&mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;I can&rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s books I&rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&rdquo;&mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9780804190640.jpg', None, "NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER Legend has it that Paxon Leah is descended from the royals and warriors who once ruled the Highlands and waged war with magical weapons. But those kings, queens, and heroes are long gone, and there is nothing enchanted about the antique sword that hangs above Paxon’s fireplace. Running his family’s modest shipping business, Paxon leads a quiet life—until extraordinary circumstances overturn his simple world . . . and rewrite his destiny. \xa0 When his brash young sister is abducted by a menacing stranger, Paxon races to her rescue with the only weapon he can find. And in a harrowing duel, he is stunned to discover powerful magic unleashed within him—and within his ancestors’ ancient blade. But his formidable new ability is dangerous in untrained hands, and Paxon must master it quickly because his nearly fatal clash with the dark sorcerer Arcannen won’t be his last. Leaving behind home and hearth, he journeys to the keep of the fabled Druid order to learn the secrets of magic and earn the right to become their sworn protector. \xa0 But treachery is afoot deep in the Druids’ ranks. And the blackest of sorcery is twisting a helpless innocent into a murderous agent of evil. To halt an insidious plot that threatens not only the Druid order but all the Four Lands, Paxon Leah must summon the profound magic in his blood and the legendary mettle of his elders in the battle fate has chosen him to fight. But those kings, queens, and heroes are long gone, and there is nothing enchanted about the antique sword that hangs above Paxon&amp;rsquo;s fireplace. Running his family&amp;rsquo;s modest shipping business, Paxon leads a quiet life&amp;mdash;until extraordinary circumstances overturn his simple world . . . and rewrite his destiny.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n When his brash young sister is abducted by a menacing stranger, Paxon races to her rescue with the only weapon he can find. And in a harrowing duel, he is stunned to discover powerful magic unleashed within him&amp;mdash;and within his ancestors&amp;rsquo; ancient blade. But his formidable new ability is dangerous in untrained hands, and Paxon must master it quickly because his nearly fatal clash with the dark sorcerer Arcannen won&amp;rsquo;t be his last. Leaving behind home and hearth, he journeys to the keep of the fabled Druid order to learn the secrets of magic and earn the right to become their sworn protector.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n But treachery is afoot deep in the Druids&amp;rsquo; ranks. And the blackest of sorcery is twisting a helpless innocent into a murderous agent of evil. To halt an insidious plot that threatens not only the Druid order but all the Four Lands, Paxon Leah must summon the profound magic in his blood and the legendary mettle of his elders in the battle fate has chosen him to fight.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nPraise for The High Druid&amp;rsquo;s Blade&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;High adventure, lots of action, and appealing [characters] . . . a good place for new readers to jump into the author\'s world.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Library Journal&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;Terry Brooks is a grandmaster of the fantasy genre, and his latest will both captivate and surprise readers. . . . It&amp;rsquo;s truly magical.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Associated Press&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Brooks once again gifts readers with a breathless adventure in this new Shannara trilogy, the Defenders of Shannara. The action begins in the first chapter and doesn&amp;rsquo;t end until the last page.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;RT Book Reviews&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;A great place to introduce yourself to all of Brooks&amp;rsquo;s novels . . . [The High Druid&amp;rsquo;s Blade] is a great stand-alone book and will definitely throw you headfirst into the world of Shannara.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Whedonopolis&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;The High Druid\'s Blade is an intriguing, action-filled novel that you are sure to love.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Faire&amp;rsquo;s Fair Book Reviews&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Readers both new [and old] will enjoy reading The High Druid&amp;rsquo;s Blade.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;The Arched Doorway&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;An enjoyable read . . . I will definitely be picking up the next book when it comes out.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Jessie Reads Everything&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Praise for Terry Brooks&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;I can&amp;rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s books I&amp;rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years.                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/664/terry-brooks">Terry Brooks</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/1170/simon-vance">Simon Vance</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">July 2014</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">10 hours 20 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER<br />\r\n<br />\r\nLegend has it that Paxon Leah is descended from the royals and warriors who once ruled the Highlands and waged war with magical weapons. But those kings, queens, and heroes are long gone, and there is nothing enchanted about the antique sword that hangs above Paxon&rsquo;s fireplace. Running his family&rsquo;s modest shipping business, Paxon leads a quiet life&mdash;until extraordinary circumstances overturn his simple world . . . and rewrite his destiny.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n When his brash young sister is abducted by a menacing stranger, Paxon races to her rescue with the only weapon he can find. And in a harrowing duel, he is stunned to discover powerful magic unleashed within him&mdash;and within his ancestors&rsquo; ancient blade. But his formidable new ability is dangerous in untrained hands, and Paxon must master it quickly because his nearly fatal clash with the dark sorcerer Arcannen won&rsquo;t be his last. Leaving behind home and hearth, he journeys to the keep of the fabled Druid order to learn the secrets of magic and earn the right to become their sworn protector.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n But treachery is afoot deep in the Druids&rsquo; ranks. And the blackest of sorcery is twisting a helpless innocent into a murderous agent of evil. To halt an insidious plot that threatens not only the Druid order but all the Four Lands, Paxon Leah must summon the profound magic in his blood and the legendary mettle of his elders in the battle fate has chosen him to fight.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for The High Druid&rsquo;s Blade<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n&ldquo;High adventure, lots of action, and appealing [characters] . . . a good place for new readers to jump into the author\'s world.&rdquo;&mdash;Library Journal<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;Terry Brooks is a grandmaster of the fantasy genre, and his latest will both captivate and surprise readers. . . . It&rsquo;s truly magical.&rdquo;&mdash;Associated Press<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Brooks once again gifts readers with a breathless adventure in this new Shannara trilogy, the Defenders of Shannara. The action begins in the first chapter and doesn&rsquo;t end until the last page.&rdquo;&mdash;RT Book Reviews<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;A great place to introduce yourself to all of Brooks&rsquo;s novels . . . [The High Druid&rsquo;s Blade] is a great stand-alone book and will definitely throw you headfirst into the world of Shannara.&rdquo;&mdash;Whedonopolis<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The High Druid\'s Blade is an intriguing, action-filled novel that you are sure to love.&rdquo;&mdash;Faire&rsquo;s Fair Book Reviews<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Readers both new [and old] will enjoy reading The High Druid&rsquo;s Blade.&rdquo;&mdash;The Arched Doorway<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;An enjoyable read . . . I will definitely be picking up the next book when it comes out.&rdquo;&mdash;Jessie Reads Everything<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for Terry Brooks<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The Sword of Shannara is an unforgettable and wildly entertaining epic, animated by Terry Brooks&rsquo;s cosmically generative imagination and storytelling joy.&rdquo;&mdash;Karen Russell, New York Times bestselling author of Swamplandia!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&rdquo;&mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;I can&rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s books I&rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&rdquo;&mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9780307913692.jpg', None, 'NEW YORK TIMES\xa0BESTSELLER The adventure that started in Wards of Faerie takes a thrilling new turn, in the second novel of Terry Brooks’s brand-new trilogy—The Dark Legacy of Shannara! The quest for the long-lost Elfstones has drawn the leader of the Druid order and her followers into the hellish dimension known as the Forbidding, where the most dangerous creatures banished from the Four Lands are imprisoned. Now the hunt for the powerful talismans that can save their world has become a series of great challenges: a desperate search for kidnapped comrades, a relentless battle against unspeakable predators, and a grim race to escape the Forbidding alive. But though freedom is closer than they know, it may come at a terrifying price. \xa0 Back in the village of Arborlon, the mystical, sentient tree that maintains the barrier between the Four Lands and the Forbidding is dying. And with each passing day, as the breach between the two worlds grows larger, the threat of the evil eager to spill forth and wreak havoc grows more dire. The only hope lies with a young Druid, faced with a staggering choice: cling to the life she cherishes or combat an army of darkness by making the ultimate sacrifice. Now the hunt for the powerful talismans that can save their world has become a series of great challenges: a desperate search for kidnapped comrades, a relentless battle against unspeakable predators, and a grim race to escape the Forbidding alive. But though freedom is closer than they know, it may come at a terrifying price.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Back in the village of Arborlon, the mystical, sentient tree that maintains the barrier between the Four Lands and the Forbidding is dying. And with each passing day, as the breach between the two worlds grows larger, the threat of the evil eager to spill forth and wreak havoc grows more dire. The only hope lies with a young Druid, faced with a staggering choice: cling to the life she cherishes or combat an army of darkness by making the ultimate sacrifice.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nIncludes a preview of the next book in the Dark Legacy of Shannara series, Witch Wraith&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nPraise for Bloodfire Quest&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Explodes from the first page . . . and the action doesn&amp;rsquo;t stop until the novel&amp;rsquo;s cliffhanger ending. . . .                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/664/terry-brooks">Terry Brooks</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/7252/rosalyn-landor">Rosalyn Landor</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">March 2013</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">12 hours 55 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">NEW YORK TIMES&#160;BESTSELLER<br />\r\n<br />\r\nThe adventure that started in Wards of Faerie takes a thrilling new turn, in the second novel of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s brand-new trilogy&mdash;The Dark Legacy of Shannara!<br />\r\n<br />\r\nThe quest for the long-lost Elfstones has drawn the leader of the Druid order and her followers into the hellish dimension known as the Forbidding, where the most dangerous creatures banished from the Four Lands are imprisoned. Now the hunt for the powerful talismans that can save their world has become a series of great challenges: a desperate search for kidnapped comrades, a relentless battle against unspeakable predators, and a grim race to escape the Forbidding alive. But though freedom is closer than they know, it may come at a terrifying price.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Back in the village of Arborlon, the mystical, sentient tree that maintains the barrier between the Four Lands and the Forbidding is dying. And with each passing day, as the breach between the two worlds grows larger, the threat of the evil eager to spill forth and wreak havoc grows more dire. The only hope lies with a young Druid, faced with a staggering choice: cling to the life she cherishes or combat an army of darkness by making the ultimate sacrifice.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nIncludes a preview of the next book in the Dark Legacy of Shannara series, Witch Wraith<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for Bloodfire Quest<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Explodes from the first page . . . and the action doesn&rsquo;t stop until the novel&rsquo;s cliffhanger ending. . . . Intense and exhilarating . . . The author balances character development with intense action, and he has a gift for creating characters the reader cares about. Brooks is one of the best fantasy writers in the business, and Bloodfire Quest is better than its predecessor.&rdquo;&mdash;Associated Press<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Shannara fans will delight in Brooks&rsquo;s sorcerous action, skilled characterizations, and rapid-fire storytelling twists.&rdquo;&mdash;Publishers Weekly<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Brooks mixes things up here with several sharp battle scenes, for which he brings his distinct talent, giving a true grandeur to clashes involving terrifying creatures and powerful magic. . . . A fine middle chapter to Brooks&rsquo; latest Shannara adventure.&rdquo;&mdash;Kirkus Reviews<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;From the first pages to the harrowing ending, Bloodfire Quest . . . is a thrill ride that will leave readers wanting more. . . . This volume, paired with the first, might be just the right place to introduce new readers to this fine writer.&rdquo;&mdash;Booklist (starred review)<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for Terry Brooks<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;I can&rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s books I&rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&rdquo;&mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks has been my constant companion over a lifetime of exploring my beloved fantasy genre. I say with all honesty I would not be writing epic fantasy today if not for Shannara. If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&rdquo;&mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. Not only do I owe him for many hours of reading pleasure, I owe him my job. He is required reading.&rdquo;&mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9780307913692.jpg', None, 'NEW YORK TIMES\xa0BESTSELLER The adventure that started in Wards of Faerie takes a thrilling new turn, in the second novel of Terry Brooks’s brand-new trilogy—The Dark Legacy of Shannara! The quest for the long-lost Elfstones has drawn the leader of the Druid order and her followers into the hellish dimension known as the Forbidding, where the most dangerous creatures banished from the Four Lands are imprisoned. Now the hunt for the powerful talismans that can save their world has become a series of great challenges: a desperate search for kidnapped comrades, a relentless battle against unspeakable predators, and a grim race to escape the Forbidding alive. But though freedom is closer than they know, it may come at a terrifying price. \xa0 Back in the village of Arborlon, the mystical, sentient tree that maintains the barrier between the Four Lands and the Forbidding is dying. And with each passing day, as the breach between the two worlds grows larger, the threat of the evil eager to spill forth and wreak havoc grows more dire. The only hope lies with a young Druid, faced with a staggering choice: cling to the life she cherishes or combat an army of darkness by making the ultimate sacrifice. Includes a preview of the next book in the Dark Legacy of Shannara series, Witch Wraith Praise for Bloodfire Quest \xa0 “Explodes from the first page . . . and the action doesn’t stop until the novel’s cliffhanger ending. . . . Intense and exhilarating . . . The author balances character development with intense action, and he has a gift for creating characters the reader cares about. Brooks is one of the best fantasy writers in the business, and Bloodfire Quest is better than its predecessor.”—Associated Press \xa0 “Shannara fans will delight in Brooks’s sorcerous action, skilled characterizations, and rapid-fire storytelling twists.”—Publishers Weekly \xa0 “Brooks mixes things up here with several sharp battle scenes, for which he brings his distinct talent, giving a true grandeur to clashes involving terrifying creatures and powerful magic. . . . Now the hunt for the powerful talismans that can save their world has become a series of great challenges: a desperate search for kidnapped comrades, a relentless battle against unspeakable predators, and a grim race to escape the Forbidding alive. But though freedom is closer than they know, it may come at a terrifying price.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Back in the village of Arborlon, the mystical, sentient tree that maintains the barrier between the Four Lands and the Forbidding is dying. And with each passing day, as the breach between the two worlds grows larger, the threat of the evil eager to spill forth and wreak havoc grows more dire. The only hope lies with a young Druid, faced with a staggering choice: cling to the life she cherishes or combat an army of darkness by making the ultimate sacrifice.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nIncludes a preview of the next book in the Dark Legacy of Shannara series, Witch Wraith&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nPraise for Bloodfire Quest&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Explodes from the first page . . . and the action doesn&amp;rsquo;t stop until the novel&amp;rsquo;s cliffhanger ending. . . . Intense and exhilarating . . . The author balances character development with intense action, and he has a gift for creating characters the reader cares about. Brooks is one of the best fantasy writers in the business, and Bloodfire Quest is better than its predecessor.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Associated Press&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Shannara fans will delight in Brooks&amp;rsquo;s sorcerous action, skilled characterizations, and rapid-fire storytelling twists.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Publishers Weekly&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Brooks mixes things up here with several sharp battle scenes, for which he brings his distinct talent, giving a true grandeur to clashes involving terrifying creatures and powerful magic. . . . A fine middle chapter to Brooks&amp;rsquo; latest Shannara adventure.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Kirkus Reviews&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;From the first pages to the harrowing ending, Bloodfire Quest . . . is a thrill ride that will leave readers wanting more. . . . This volume, paired with the first, might be just the right place to introduce new readers to this fine writer.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Booklist (starred review)&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Praise for Terry Brooks&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;I can&amp;rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&amp;rsquo;s books I&amp;rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Terry Brooks has been my constant companion over a lifetime of exploring my beloved fantasy genre. I say with all honesty I would not be writing epic fantasy today if not for Shannara. If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. Not only do I owe him for many hours of reading pleasure, I owe him my job. He is required reading.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy"/>\n\t\n    \n\t<title>Listen to Bloodfire Quest: The Dark Legacy of Shannara by                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/664/terry-brooks">Terry Brooks</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/7252/rosalyn-landor">Rosalyn Landor</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">March 2013</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">12 hours 55 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">NEW YORK TIMES&#160;BESTSELLER<br />\r\n<br />\r\nThe adventure that started in Wards of Faerie takes a thrilling new turn, in the second novel of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s brand-new trilogy&mdash;The Dark Legacy of Shannara!<br />\r\n<br />\r\nThe quest for the long-lost Elfstones has drawn the leader of the Druid order and her followers into the hellish dimension known as the Forbidding, where the most dangerous creatures banished from the Four Lands are imprisoned. Now the hunt for the powerful talismans that can save their world has become a series of great challenges: a desperate search for kidnapped comrades, a relentless battle against unspeakable predators, and a grim race to escape the Forbidding alive. But though freedom is closer than they know, it may come at a terrifying price.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Back in the village of Arborlon, the mystical, sentient tree that maintains the barrier between the Four Lands and the Forbidding is dying. And with each passing day, as the breach between the two worlds grows larger, the threat of the evil eager to spill forth and wreak havoc grows more dire. The only hope lies with a young Druid, faced with a staggering choice: cling to the life she cherishes or combat an army of darkness by making the ultimate sacrifice.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nIncludes a preview of the next book in the Dark Legacy of Shannara series, Witch Wraith<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for Bloodfire Quest<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Explodes from the first page . . . and the action doesn&rsquo;t stop until the novel&rsquo;s cliffhanger ending. . . . Intense and exhilarating . . . The author balances character development with intense action, and he has a gift for creating characters the reader cares about. Brooks is one of the best fantasy writers in the business, and Bloodfire Quest is better than its predecessor.&rdquo;&mdash;Associated Press<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Shannara fans will delight in Brooks&rsquo;s sorcerous action, skilled characterizations, and rapid-fire storytelling twists.&rdquo;&mdash;Publishers Weekly<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Brooks mixes things up here with several sharp battle scenes, for which he brings his distinct talent, giving a true grandeur to clashes involving terrifying creatures and powerful magic. . . . A fine middle chapter to Brooks&rsquo; latest Shannara adventure.&rdquo;&mdash;Kirkus Reviews<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;From the first pages to the harrowing ending, Bloodfire Quest . . . is a thrill ride that will leave readers wanting more. . . . This volume, paired with the first, might be just the right place to introduce new readers to this fine writer.&rdquo;&mdash;Booklist (starred review)<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for Terry Brooks<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;I can&rsquo;t even begin to count how many of Terry Brooks&rsquo;s books I&rsquo;ve read (and reread) over the years. From Shannara to Landover, his work was a huge part of my childhood.&rdquo;&mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks has been my constant companion over a lifetime of exploring my beloved fantasy genre. I say with all honesty I would not be writing epic fantasy today if not for Shannara. If Tolkien is the grandfather of modern fantasy, Terry Brooks is its favorite uncle.&rdquo;&mdash;Peter V. Brett, New York Times bestselling author of The Desert Spear<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Terry Brooks is a master of the craft and a trailblazer who established fantasy as a viable genre. Not only do I owe him for many hours of reading pleasure, I owe him my job. He is required reading.&rdquo;&mdash;Brent Weeks, New York Times bestselling author of The Night Angel Trilogy</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n York Times-bestselling Tad Williams’ ground-breaking epic fantasy saga of Osten Ard begins an exciting new cycle! • Volume One of The Last King of Osten Ard The Dragonbone Chair, the first volume of Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn, was published in hardcover in October, 1988, launching the series that was to become one of the seminal works of modern epic fantasy. Many of today’s top-selling fantasy authors, from Patrick Rothfuss to George R. R. Martin to Christopher Paolini credit Tad with being the inspiration for their own series. Now, twenty-four years after the conclusion of Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn, Tad returns to his beloved universe and characters with The Witchwood Crown, the first novel in the long-awaited sequel trilogy, The Last King of Osten Ard.  More than thirty years have passed since the events of the earlier novels, and the world has reached a critical turning point once again. The realm is threatened by divisive forces, even as old allies are lost, and others are lured down darker paths. Perhaps most terrifying of all, the Norns—the long-vanquished elvish foe—are stirring once again, preparing to reclaim the mortal-ruled lands that once were theirs....                                                          <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8690/tad-williams">Tad Williams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/25999/andrew-wincott">Andrew Wincott</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Penguin Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">June 2017</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">38 hours 40 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">New York Times-bestselling Tad Williams&rsquo; ground-breaking epic fantasy saga of Osten Ard begins an exciting new cycle! &bull; Volume One of The Last King of Osten Ard<br />\r\n<br />\r\nThe Dragonbone Chair, the first volume of Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn, was published in hardcover in October, 1988, launching the series that was to become one of the seminal works of modern epic fantasy. Many of today&rsquo;s top-selling fantasy authors, from Patrick Rothfuss to George R. R. Martin to Christopher Paolini credit Tad with being the inspiration for their own series.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nNow, twenty-four years after the conclusion of Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn, Tad returns to his beloved universe and characters with The Witchwood Crown, the first novel in the long-awaited sequel trilogy, The Last King of Osten Ard. <br />\r\n<br />\r\nMore than thirty years have passed since the events of the earlier novels, and the world has reached a critical turning point once again. The realm is threatened by divisive forces, even as old allies are lost, and others are lured down darker paths. Perhaps most terrifying of all, the Norns&mdash;the long-vanquished elvish foe&mdash;are stirring once again, preparing to reclaim the mortal-ruled lands that once were theirs....</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy" genre-id="1"><span itemprop="title">Science Fiction & Fantasy</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy/fantasy" genre-id="2"><span itemprop="title">Fantasy</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div Novel</h1>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix audiobookVersion">\r\n                            <h4 class="fleft nobold">Unabridged Audiobook\r\n                                                        </h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/177963/isabelle-steiger">Isabelle Steiger</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/39548/jeremy-arthur">Jeremy Arthur</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Macmillan Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">July 2020</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">19 hours 0 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">The second audiobook in Isabelle Steiger\'s epic fantasy series, which weaves together the lives of the haves and the have-nots-both desperately fighting to reassemble the remains of a fallen empire. <br />\r\n<br />\r\nIsabelle Steiger\'s debut The Empire\'s Ghost was praised by Booklist as a \'well-crafted tale that is ripe for a sequel\' with a cast of compelling characters and a tantalizing plot. In The Rightful Queen, Steiger returns us to the empire of Elesthene in a continuation of her epic fantasy series.<br />\r\nThe Rightful Queen is another example of author Isabelle Steiger\'s powerful writing, full of intricate characters and complex world-building that\'s reminiscent of George R. R. Martin and Patrick Rothfuss.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy" genre-id="1"><span itemprop="title">Science Fiction & Fantasy</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url"                                                          <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/176732/megan-whalen-turner">Megan Whalen Turner</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/29409/steve-west">Steve West</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Greenwillow Books</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">May 2017</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">7 hours 42 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Discover the world of the Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief<br />\r\n<br />\r\nNew York Times-bestselling author Megan Whalen Turner\xe2\x80\x99s entrancing and award-winning Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief novels bring to life the world of the epics and feature one of the most charismatic and incorrigible characters of fiction, Eugenides the thief. Megan Whalen Turner\xe2\x80\x99s Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief novels are rich with political machinations and intrigue, battles lost and won, dangerous journeys, divine intervention, power, passion, revenge, and deception. Perfect for fans of Leigh Bardugo, Marie Lu, Patrick Rothfuss, and George R. R. Martin.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nEugenides, the queen\xe2\x80\x99s thief, can steal anything\xe2\x80\x94or so he says. When his boasting lands him in prison and the king\xe2\x80\x99s magus invites him on a quest to steal a legendary object, he\xe2\x80\x99s in no position to refuse. The magus thinks he has the right tool for the job, but Gen has plans of his own. The Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief novels have been praised by writers, critics, reviewers, and fans, and have been honored with glowing reviews, \xe2\x80\x9cbest of\xe2\x80\x9d citations, and numerous awards, including the Los Angeles Times Book Prize, a Newbery Honor, the Andre Norton Award shortlist, and the Mythopoeic Fantasy Award. Discover and rediscover the stand-alone companions, The Queen of Attolia, The King of Attolia, and A Conspiracy of Kings, all epic novels set in the world of the Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief. <br />\r\n<br />\r\nA Newbery Honor Book<br />\r\n<br />\r\nAn ALA Notable Book<br />\r\n<br />\r\nA YALSA Best Book for Young Adults<br />\r\nA Horn Book Fanfare Book<br />\r\nA New York Public Library Book for the Teen Age<br />\r\nA Bulletin of the Center for Children\xe2\x80\x99s Books Blue Ribbon Book<br />\r\nA Junior Library Guild Selection<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cThe Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief books awe and inspire me. They have the feel of a secret, discovered history of real but forgotten lands. The plot-craft is peerless, the revelations stunning, and the characters flawed, cunning, heartbreaking, exceptional. Megan Whalen Turner\xe2\x80\x99s books have a permanent spot on my favorites shelf, with space waiting for more books to come.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94Laini Taylor, New York Times-bestselling author of the Daughter of Smoke and Bone novels and Strange the Dreamer<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\'Unforgettable characters, plot twists that will make your head spin, a world rendered in elegant detail\xe2\x80\x94you will fall in love with every page of these stories. Megan Whalen Turner writes vivid, immersive, heartbreaking fantasy that will leave you desperate to return to Attolia again and again.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94Leigh Bardugo, #1&#160;New York Times\xe2\x80\x94bestselling author of&#160;Six of Crows&#160;and&#160;Crooked Kingdom<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cTrust me. Just read it. Then read it again, because it will not be the same river twice.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94Lois McMaster Bujold, acclaimed and Hugo Award-winning author of the Vorkosigan Saga, the Chalion Series, and the Sharing Knife series<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\'In addition to its charismatic hero, this story possesses one of the most valuable treasures of all\xe2\x80\x94a twinkling jewel of a surprise ending.\' \xe2\x80\x94Publishers Weekly (starred review)<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cTo miss this thief\xe2\x80\x99s story would be a crime.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94Bulletin of the Center for Children\xe2\x80\x99s Books (starred review)<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cA literary journey that enriches both its characters and readers before it is over.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94Kirkus Reviews (starred review)<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cA tantalizing, suspenseful, exceptionally clever novel.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94the Horn Book (starred review)</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n
