True, None], 51.25], [['AUDIOBOOK', 'After On: A Novel of Silicon Valley', <PIL.Image.Image image mode=L size=344x521 at 0x17DDF1AA048>, 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9780525529125.jpg', None, 'The definitive novel of today’s Silicon Valley, After On flash-captures our cultural and technological moment with up-to-the-instant savvy. Matters of privacy and government intrusion, post-Tinder romance, nihilistic terrorism, artificial consciousness, synthetic biology, and much more are tackled with authority and brash playfulness by New York Times bestselling author Rob Reid. Meet Phluttr—a diabolically addictive new social network and a villainess, heroine, enemy, and/or bestie to millions. Phluttr has ingested every fact and message ever sent to, from, and about her innumerable users. Her capabilities astound her makers—and they don’t even know the tenth of it. \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 But what’s the purpose of this stunning creation? Is it a front for something even darker and more powerful than the NSA? A bid to create a trillion-dollar market by becoming “The UberX of Sex”? Or a reckless experiment that could spawn the digital equivalent of a middle-school mean girl with enough charisma, dirt, and cunning to bend the entire planet to her will? Phluttr has it in her to become the greatest gossip, flirt, or matchmaker in history. Or she could cure cancer, bring back Seinfeld, then start a nuclear war. Whatever she does, it’s not up to us. But a motley band of Silicon Valley entrepreneurs, venture capitalists, and engineers might be able to influence her. After On achieves the literary singularity—fusing speculative satire and astonishing reality into a sharp-witted, ferociously believable, IMAX-wide view of our digital age. Narrated by\xa0Sean Kenin\xa0and\xa0January LaVoy,\xa0with: Felicia Day:\xa0NETGRRRL.COM Patrick Rothfuss:\xa0Special Field Operative Brock Hogan John Hodgman:\xa0Charles Henry Higgensworth III Tom Merritt:\xa0voice of The\xa0New York Times Jesse Cox:\xa0 Whistle Blowings Blog Leo Laporte:\xa0voice of the San Francisco Chronicle Advance praise for After On “Enter a near-future Silicon Valley that is hilariously, creepily, mind-bogglingly fantastic, yet at the same time all too believable. It might turn out this way. No, really, it might! Along with After On’s diabolically ingenious plot, there are crazy-plausible web startups, delicious parodies of social media, and a surprisingly convincing theory of human consciousness.”—Chris Anderson, head of TED “Reading After On is like attending a master class in nearly every major issue haunting not only the tech industry but society itself. Only the professor is also a stand-up comic with a perfect ear for the foibles of Silicon Valley’s most sacred cows. Part AI thriller, part arch social commentary, and part rollicking farce, After On will leave you smarter about just about everything the human species needs to work on if we’re going to outlive our own creations—and our obsessions with them.”—John Battelle, co-founder, NewCo, Federated Media, and Wired “The future is already here—it’s just for those who read Reid!”—Steve Jurvetson, venture capitalist, Draper Fisher Jurvetson “Rob Reid doesn’t write science fiction; he writes future history. After On is the best account I’ve read of how superintelligence will arrive and what it will mean for all of us. Matters of privacy and government intrusion, post-Tinder romance, nihilistic terrorism, artificial consciousness, synthetic biology, and much more are tackled with authority and brash playfulness by New York Times bestselling author Rob Reid.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Meet Phluttr&amp;mdash;a diabolically addictive new social network and a villainess, heroine, enemy, and/or bestie to millions. Phluttr has ingested every fact and message ever sent to, from, and about her innumerable users. Her capabilities astound her makers&amp;mdash;and they don&amp;rsquo;t even know the tenth of it.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;#160; &amp;#160; &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n But what&amp;rsquo;s the purpose of this stunning creation? Is it a front for something even darker and more powerful than the NSA? A bid to create a trillion-dollar market by becoming &amp;ldquo;The UberX of Sex&amp;rdquo;? Or a reckless experiment that could spawn the digital equivalent of a middle-school mean girl with enough charisma, dirt, and cunning to bend the entire planet to her will?&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Phluttr has it in her to become the greatest gossip, flirt, or matchmaker in history. Or she could cure cancer, bring back Seinfeld, then start a nuclear war. Whatever she does, it&amp;rsquo;s not up to us. But a motley band of Silicon Valley entrepreneurs, venture capitalists, and engineers might be able to influence her.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n After On achieves the literary singularity&amp;mdash;fusing speculative satire and astonishing reality into a sharp-witted, ferociously believable, IMAX-wide view of our digital age.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nNarrated by&amp;#160;Sean Kenin&amp;#160;and&amp;#160;January LaVoy,&amp;#160;with:&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Felicia Day:&amp;#160;NETGRRRL.COM&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Patrick Rothfuss:&amp;#160;Special Field Operative Brock Hogan&lt;br /&gt;\r\n John Hodgman:&amp;#160;Charles Henry Higgensworth III&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Tom Merritt:&amp;#160;voice of The&amp;#160;New York Times&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Jesse Cox:&amp;#160; Whistle Blowings Blog&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Leo Laporte:&amp;#160;voice of the San Francisco Chronicle&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nAdvance praise for After On&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Enter a near-future Silicon Valley that is hilariously, creepily, mind-bogglingly fantastic, yet at the same time all too believable. It might turn out this way. No, really, it might! Along with After On&amp;rsquo;s diabolically ingenious plot, there are crazy-plausible web startups, delicious parodies of social media, and a surprisingly convincing theory of human consciousness.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Chris Anderson, head of TED&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Reading After On is like attending a master class in nearly every major issue haunting not only the tech industry but society itself. Only the professor is also a stand-up comic with a perfect ear for the foibles of Silicon Valley&amp;rsquo;s most sacred cows. Part AI thriller, part arch social commentary, and part rollicking farce, After On will leave you smarter about just about everything the human species needs to work on if we&amp;rsquo;re going to outlive our own creations&amp;mdash;and our obsessions with them.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;John Battelle, co-founder, NewCo, Federated Media, and Wired&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;The future is already here&amp;mdash;it&amp;rsquo;s just for those who read Reid!&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Steve Jurvetson, venture capitalist, Draper Fisher Jurvetson&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Rob Reid doesn&amp;rsquo;t write science fiction; he writes future history. After On is the best account I&amp;rsquo;ve read of how superintelligence will arrive and what it will mean for all of us. Hilarious, frightening, believable, and marvelously constructed&amp;mdash;After On has it all.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Hugh Howey, New York Times bestselling author of Wool"/>\n\t\n    \n\t<title>Listen class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/37318/rob-reid">Rob Reid</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/1079/john-hodgman">John Hodgman</a></span>, <span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/17910/sean-kenin">Sean Kenin</a></span>, <span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/24204/patrick-rothfuss">Patrick Rothfuss</a></span>, <span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/40794/leo-laporte">Leo Laporte</a></span>, <span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/40801/tom-merritt">Tom Merritt</a></span>, <span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/164947/felicia-day">Felicia Day</a></span>, <span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/190047/january-lavoy">January Lavoy</a></span>, <span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/226164/jesse-cox">Jesse Cox</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">August 2017</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">22 hours 5 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">The definitive novel of today&rsquo;s Silicon Valley, After On flash-captures our cultural and technological moment with up-to-the-instant savvy. Matters of privacy and government intrusion, post-Tinder romance, nihilistic terrorism, artificial consciousness, synthetic biology, and much more are tackled with authority and brash playfulness by New York Times bestselling author Rob Reid.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n Meet Phluttr&mdash;a diabolically addictive new social network and a villainess, heroine, enemy, and/or bestie to millions. Phluttr has ingested every fact and message ever sent to, from, and about her innumerable users. Her capabilities astound her makers&mdash;and they don&rsquo;t even know the tenth of it.<br />\r\n&#160; &#160; &#160;<br />\r\n But what&rsquo;s the purpose of this stunning creation? Is it a front for something even darker and more powerful than the NSA? A bid to create a trillion-dollar market by becoming &ldquo;The UberX of Sex&rdquo;? Or a reckless experiment that could spawn the digital equivalent of a middle-school mean girl with enough charisma, dirt, and cunning to bend the entire planet to her will?<br />\r\n<br />\r\n Phluttr has it in her to become the greatest gossip, flirt, or matchmaker in history. Or she could cure cancer, bring back Seinfeld, then start a nuclear war. Whatever she does, it&rsquo;s not up to us. But a motley band of Silicon Valley entrepreneurs, venture capitalists, and engineers might be able to influence her.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n After On achieves the literary singularity&mdash;fusing speculative satire and astonishing reality into a sharp-witted, ferociously believable, IMAX-wide view of our digital age.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nNarrated by&#160;Sean Kenin&#160;and&#160;January LaVoy,&#160;with:<br />\r\n Felicia Day:&#160;NETGRRRL.COM<br />\r\n Patrick Rothfuss:&#160;Special Field Operative Brock Hogan<br />\r\n John Hodgman:&#160;Charles Henry Higgensworth III<br />\r\n Tom Merritt:&#160;voice of The&#160;New York Times<br />\r\n Jesse Cox:&#160; Whistle Blowings Blog<br />\r\n Leo Laporte:&#160;voice of the San Francisco Chronicle<br />\r\n<br />\r\nAdvance praise for After On<br />\r\n<br />\r\n &ldquo;Enter a near-future Silicon Valley that is hilariously, creepily, mind-bogglingly fantastic, yet at the same time all too believable. It might turn out this way. No, really, it might! Along with After On&rsquo;s diabolically ingenious plot, there are crazy-plausible web startups, delicious parodies of social media, and a surprisingly convincing theory of human consciousness.&rdquo;&mdash;Chris Anderson, head of TED<br />\r\n<br />\r\n &ldquo;Reading After On is like attending a master class in nearly every major issue haunting not only the tech industry but society itself. Only the professor is also a stand-up comic with a perfect ear for the foibles of Silicon Valley&rsquo;s most sacred cows. Part AI thriller, part arch social commentary, and part rollicking farce, After On will leave you smarter about just about everything the human species needs to work on if we&rsquo;re going to outlive our own creations&mdash;and our obsessions with them.&rdquo;&mdash;John Battelle, co-founder, NewCo, Federated Media, and Wired<br />\r\n<br />\r\n &ldquo;The future is already here&mdash;it&rsquo;s just for those who read Reid!&rdquo;&mdash;Steve Jurvetson, venture capitalist, Draper Fisher Jurvetson<br />\r\n<br />\r\n &ldquo;Rob Reid doesn&rsquo;t write science fiction; he writes future history. After On is the best account I&rsquo;ve read of how superintelligence will arrive and what it will mean for all of us. Hilarious, frightening, believable, and marvelously constructed&mdash;After On has it all.&rdquo;&mdash;Hugh Howey, New York Times bestselling author of Wool</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n "Discover the world of the Queen’s Thief New York Times-bestselling author Megan Whalen Turner’s entrancing and award-winning Queen’s Thief novels bring to life the world of the epics and feature one of the most charismatic and incorrigible characters of fiction, Eugenides the thief. Megan Whalen Turner’s Queen’s Thief novels are rich with political machinations and intrigue, battles lost and won, dangerous journeys, divine intervention, power, passion, revenge, and deception. The New York Times bestseller A Conspiracy of Kings won the Los Angeles Times Book Award and is perfect for fans of Leigh Bardugo, Marie Lu, Patrick Rothfuss, and George R. R. Martin. After an attempted assassination and kidnapping, Sophos, heir to the throne of Sounis, disappears. Those who care for him—including the thief Eugenides and the Queen of Eddis—are left to wonder if he is alive and if they will ever see him again. The Queen’s Thief novels have been praised by writers, critics, reviewers, and fans and have been honored with glowing reviews, “best of” citations, and numerous awards, including the Los Angeles Times Book Prize, a Newbery Honor, the Andre Norton Award shortlist, and the Mythopoeic Fantasy Award. Discover and rediscover the stand-alone companions, The Queen of Attolia, The King of Attolia, A Conspiracy of Kings, and Thick as Thieves, all epic novels set in the world of the Queen’s Thief.  Winner of the LA Times Book Award A New York Times Bestseller A Boston Globe-Horn Book Honor Book A School Library Journal Best Book “The Queen’s Thief books awe and inspire me. They have the feel of a secret, discovered history of real but forgotten lands. The plot-craft is peerless, the revelations stunning, and the characters flawed, cunning, heartbreaking, exceptional. Megan Whalen Turner’s books have a permanent spot on my favorites shelf, with space waiting for more books to come.”—Laini Taylor, New York Times-bestselling author of the Daughter of Smoke and Bone novels and Strange the Dreamer 'Unforgettable characters, plot twists that will make your head spin, a world rendered in elegant detail—you will fall in love with every page of these stories. Megan Whalen Turner&rsquo;s Queen&rsquo;s Thief novels are rich with political machinations and intrigue, battles lost and won, dangerous journeys, divine intervention, power, passion, revenge, and deception. The New York Times bestseller A Conspiracy of Kings won the Los Angeles Times Book Award and is perfect for fans of Leigh Bardugo, Marie Lu, Patrick Rothfuss, and George R. R. Martin.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nAfter an attempted assassination and kidnapping, Sophos, heir to the throne of Sounis, disappears. Those who care for him&mdash;including the thief Eugenides and the Queen of Eddis&mdash;are left to wonder if he is alive and if they will ever see him again. The Queen&rsquo;s Thief novels have been praised by writers, critics, reviewers, and fans and have been honored with glowing reviews, &ldquo;best of&rdquo; citations, and numerous awards, including the Los Angeles Times Book Prize, a Newbery Honor, the Andre Norton Award shortlist, and the Mythopoeic Fantasy Award.                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/176732/megan-whalen-turner">Megan Whalen Turner</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/29409/steve-west">Steve West</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Greenwillow Books</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">May 2017</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">8 hours 27 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Discover the world of the Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief<br />\r\n<br />\r\nNew York Times-bestselling author Megan Whalen Turner\xe2\x80\x99s entrancing and award-winning Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief novels bring to life the world of the epics and feature one of the most charismatic and incorrigible characters of fiction, Eugenides the thief. Megan Whalen Turner\xe2\x80\x99s Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief novels are rich with political machinations and intrigue, battles lost and won, dangerous journeys, divine intervention, power, passion, revenge, and deception. The New York Times bestseller A Conspiracy of Kings won the Los Angeles Times Book Award and is perfect for fans of Leigh Bardugo, Marie Lu, Patrick Rothfuss, and George R. R. Martin.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nAfter an attempted assassination and kidnapping, Sophos, heir to the throne of Sounis, disappears. Those who care for him\xe2\x80\x94including the thief Eugenides and the Queen of Eddis\xe2\x80\x94are left to wonder if he is alive and if they will ever see him again. The Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief novels have been praised by writers, critics, reviewers, and fans and have been honored with glowing reviews, \xe2\x80\x9cbest of\xe2\x80\x9d citations, and numerous awards, including the Los Angeles Times Book Prize, a Newbery Honor, the Andre Norton Award shortlist, and the Mythopoeic Fantasy Award. Discover and rediscover the stand-alone companions, The Queen of Attolia, The King of Attolia, A Conspiracy of Kings, and Thick as Thieves, all epic novels set in the world of the Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief. <br />\r\n<br />\r\nWinner of the LA Times Book Award<br />\r\n<br />\r\nA New York Times Bestseller<br />\r\n<br />\r\nA Boston Globe-Horn Book Honor Book<br />\r\n<br />\r\nA School Library Journal Best Book<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cThe Queen\xe2\x80\x99s Thief books awe and inspire me. They have the feel of a secret, discovered history of real but forgotten lands. The plot-craft is peerless, the revelations stunning, and the characters flawed, cunning, heartbreaking, exceptional. Megan Whalen Turner\xe2\x80\x99s books have a permanent spot on my favorites shelf, with space waiting for more books to come.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94Laini Taylor, New York Times-bestselling author of the Daughter of Smoke and Bone novels and Strange the Dreamer<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\'Unforgettable characters, plot twists that will make your head spin, a world rendered in elegant detail\xe2\x80\x94you will fall in love with every page of these stories. Megan Whalen Turner writes vivid, immersive, heartbreaking fantasy that will leave you desperate to return to Attolia again and again.\'\xe2\x80\x94Leigh Bardugo, #1&#160;New York Times-bestselling author of&#160;Six of Crows&#160;and&#160;Crooked Kingdom<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cMegan Whalen Turner is one of my all-time favorite writers . . .&#160;impossible to put down.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94Holly Black, award-winning and New York Times-bestselling author of the Modern Faerie Tale series and The Darkest Part of the Forest<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cRomance, intrigue, mystery, surprises, and sheer beautiful writing.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94Cassandra Clare, award-winning and New York Times-bestselling author of The Mortal Instruments and Lady Midnight<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cThe world Turner creates is so tangible that not only do I believe in its characters, I almost believe in its gods.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94Kristin Cashore, award-winning and New York Times-bestselling author of the Graceling Realm series<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\xe2\x80\x9cA Conspiracy of Kings brings the sweetest, sharpest kind of reading pleasure. Megan Whalen Turner\xe2\x80\x99s books are pure joy.\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94Rebecca Stead, Newbery Medalist and New York Times-bestselling author of When You Reach Me and Goodbye Stranger</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                      </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">Excellent plot and love the narrator! I am anxious for Megan Whalen Turner\xe2\x80\x99s next novel.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                </ul>\r\n                            </div>\r\n                            <div id="tab-social" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: none;">Donec in tortor in lectus iaculis vulputate. Sed aliquam, urna ut sollicitudin molestie, lacus justo aliquam mauris, interdum aliquam sapien nisi cursus mauris. Nunc hendrerit tortor vitae est placerat ut varius erat posuere. Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus.</div>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                    </div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\r\n The trilogy inspired a generation of modern fantasy writers, including George R.R. Martin, Patrick Rothfuss, and Christopher Paolini, and defined Tad Williams as one of the most important fantasy writers of our time. &amp;#8232;&amp;#8232;&amp;#8232;&amp;#8232;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n BOOK TWO: STONE OF FAREWELL&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nIt is a time of darkness, dread, and ultimate testing for the realm of Osten Ard, for the wild magic and terrifying minions of the undead Sithi ruler, Ineluki the Storm King, are spreading their seemingly undefeatable evil across the kingdom.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n With the very land blighted by the power of Ineluki&amp;rsquo;s wrath, the tattered remnants of a once-proud human army flee in search of a last sanctuary and rallying point&amp;mdash;the Stone of Farewell, a place shrouded in mystery and ancient sorrow.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n An even as Prince Josua seeks to rally his scattered forces, Simon and the surviving members of the League of the Scroll are desperately struggling to discover the truth behind an almost-forgotten legend, which will take them from the fallen citadels of humans to the secret heartland of the Sithi&amp;mdash;where near-immortals must at last decide whether to ally with the race of men in a final war against those of their own blood.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n After the landmark Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn trilogy, the epic saga of Osten Ard continues with the brand-new novel, The Heart of What Was Lost. Then don&amp;rsquo;t miss the upcoming trilogy, The Last King of Osten Ard, beginning with The Witchwood Crown!&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Praise for Osten Ard:&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n\'Inspired me to write my own seven-book trilogy.... class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8690/tad-williams">Tad Williams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/25999/andrew-wincott">Andrew Wincott</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Penguin Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">September 2016</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">32 hours 22 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">New York Times-bestselling Tad Williams&rsquo; landmark epic fantasy saga of Osten Ard begins an exciting new cycle! <br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;One of my favorite fantasy series.&rdquo; &mdash;George R. R. Martin &bull; &ldquo;Groundbreaking.&rdquo; &mdash;Patrick Rothfuss &bull; &ldquo;One of the great fantasy epics of all time.&rdquo; &mdash;Christopher Paolini<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Tad Williams introduced readers to the incredible fantasy world of Osten Ard in his internationally bestselling series Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn. The trilogy inspired a generation of modern fantasy writers, including George R.R. Martin, Patrick Rothfuss, and Christopher Paolini, and defined Tad Williams as one of the most important fantasy writers of our time. &#8232;&#8232;&#8232;&#8232;<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n BOOK TWO: STONE OF FAREWELL<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\nIt is a time of darkness, dread, and ultimate testing for the realm of Osten Ard, for the wild magic and terrifying minions of the undead Sithi ruler, Ineluki the Storm King, are spreading their seemingly undefeatable evil across the kingdom.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n With the very land blighted by the power of Ineluki&rsquo;s wrath, the tattered remnants of a once-proud human army flee in search of a last sanctuary and rallying point&mdash;the Stone of Farewell, a place shrouded in mystery and ancient sorrow.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n An even as Prince Josua seeks to rally his scattered forces, Simon and the surviving members of the League of the Scroll are desperately struggling to discover the truth behind an almost-forgotten legend, which will take them from the fallen citadels of humans to the secret heartland of the Sithi&mdash;where near-immortals must at last decide whether to ally with the race of men in a final war against those of their own blood.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n After the landmark Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn trilogy, the epic saga of Osten Ard continues with the brand-new novel, The Heart of What Was Lost. Then don&rsquo;t miss the upcoming trilogy, The Last King of Osten Ard, beginning with The Witchwood Crown!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for Osten Ard:<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n\'Inspired me to write my own seven-book trilogy.... It&rsquo;s one of my favorite fantasy series.\'<br />\r\n &mdash;George R. R. Martin, New York Times-bestselling author of A&#160;Game of Thrones<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n \'Groundbreaking...changed how people thought of the genre, and paved the way for so much modern fantasy. Including mine.\'<br />\r\n &mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times-bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n\'Tad Williams is a master storyteller, and the Osten Ard books are his masterpiece.\'&#160;&mdash;Brandon Sanderson,&#160;New York Times-bestselling author of&#160;Mistborn<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\'Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn is one of the great fantasy epics of all time.\'<br />\r\n &mdash;Christopher Paolini, New York Times-bestselling author of Eragon</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div class="book-rating-description nomargin">I enjoyed the narration mostly. I heard Binabik differently, though. The way Simon described Binabik\'s voice and laugh didn\'t jive with the narrator. He didn\'t raise his voice when the characters did, stuff like that.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">jon p</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="4"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">Good overall.      options.data[\'formy_form_token\'] = "a2ae95d53c0eb01a8542c7bf87f8757d";\n                }\n                else{\n                    options.data += "&formy_form_token=a2ae95d53c0eb01a8542c7bf87f8757d";\n                }\n\n            }\n            return _oldAjax(options);\n        };\n    })();\n\n    $(document).ready(function(){\n        var selector = $(\'form[method="post"]\');\n        if(selector.on){\n            selector.on(\'submit\', function(){\n                $(\'<input />\').attr(\'type\', \'hidden\')\n                    .attr(\'name\', "formy_form_token")\n                    .attr(\'value\', "a2ae95d53c0eb01a8542c7bf87f8757d")\n                    .appendTo(this);\n                return true;\n            })\n         .attr(\'value\', "a2ae95d53c0eb01a8542c7bf87f8757d")\n                    .appendTo(this);\n                return true;\n            })\n        }\n    });\n</script><div id="footer"      </div>\r\n                                                                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8690/tad-williams">Tad Williams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/25999/andrew-wincott">Andrew Wincott</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Penguin Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">September 2016</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">32 hours 22 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">New York Times-bestselling Tad Williams&rsquo; landmark epic fantasy saga of Osten Ard begins an exciting new cycle! <br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;One of my favorite fantasy series.&rdquo; &mdash;George R. R. Martin &bull; &ldquo;Groundbreaking.&rdquo; &mdash;Patrick Rothfuss &bull; &ldquo;One of the great fantasy epics of all time.&rdquo; &mdash;Christopher Paolini<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Tad Williams introduced readers to the incredible fantasy world of Osten Ard in his internationally bestselling series Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn. The trilogy inspired a generation of modern fantasy writers, including George R.R. Martin, Patrick Rothfuss, and Christopher Paolini, and defined Tad Williams as one of the most important fantasy writers of our time. &#8232;&#8232;&#8232;&#8232;<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n BOOK TWO: STONE OF FAREWELL<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\nIt is a time of darkness, dread, and ultimate testing for the realm of Osten Ard, for the wild magic and terrifying minions of the undead Sithi ruler, Ineluki the Storm King, are spreading their seemingly undefeatable evil across the kingdom.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n With the very land blighted by the power of Ineluki&rsquo;s wrath, the tattered remnants of a once-proud human army flee in search of a last sanctuary and rallying point&mdash;the Stone of Farewell, a place shrouded in mystery and ancient sorrow.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n An even as Prince Josua seeks to rally his scattered forces, Simon and the surviving members of the League of the Scroll are desperately struggling to discover the truth behind an almost-forgotten legend, which will take them from the fallen citadels of humans to the secret heartland of the Sithi&mdash;where near-immortals must at last decide whether to ally with the race of men in a final war against those of their own blood.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n After the landmark Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn trilogy, the epic saga of Osten Ard continues with the brand-new novel, The Heart of What Was Lost. Then don&rsquo;t miss the upcoming trilogy, The Last King of Osten Ard, beginning with The Witchwood Crown!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for Osten Ard:<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n\'Inspired me to write my own seven-book trilogy.... It&rsquo;s one of my favorite fantasy series.\'<br />\r\n &mdash;George R. R. Martin, New York Times-bestselling author of A&#160;Game of Thrones<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n \'Groundbreaking...changed how people thought of the genre, and paved the way for so much modern fantasy. Including mine.\'<br />\r\n &mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times-bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n\'Tad Williams is a master storyteller, and the Osten Ard books are his masterpiece.\'&#160;&mdash;Brandon Sanderson,&#160;New York Times-bestselling author of&#160;Mistborn<br />\r\n<br />\r\n\'Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn is one of the great fantasy epics of all time.\'<br />\r\n &mdash;Christopher Paolini, New York Times-bestselling author of Eragon</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div                 <div id="tab-reviews" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: block;">\r\n                                <ul class="sposts-list clearfix">\r\n                                                                    \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Jenifer B</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="5"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">I enjoyed the narration mostly. I heard Binabik differently, though. The way Simon described Binabik\'s voice and laugh didn\'t jive with the narrator. He didn\'t raise his voice when the characters did, stuff like that.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">jon p</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="4"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">Good overall. A bit overly discriptive in parts</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                </ul>\r\n                            </div>\r\n                            <div id="tab-social" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: none;">Donec in tortor in lectus iaculis vulputate. Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8690/tad-williams">Tad Williams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/25999/andrew-wincott">Andrew Wincott</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Penguin Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">November 2016</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">63 hours 9 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">New York Times-bestselling Tad Williams&rsquo; landmark epic fantasy saga of Osten Ard begins an exciting new cycle! <br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;One of my favorite fantasy series.&rdquo; &mdash;George R. R. Martin &bull; &ldquo;Groundbreaking.&rdquo; &mdash;Patrick Rothfuss &bull; &ldquo;One of the great fantasy epics of all time.&rdquo; &mdash;Christopher Paolini<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Tad Williams introduced readers to the incredible fantasy world of Osten Ard in his internationally bestselling series Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn. The trilogy inspired a generation of modern fantasy writers, including George R.R. Martin, Patrick Rothfuss, and Christopher Paolini, and defined Tad Williams as one of the most important fantasy writers of our time. &#8232;&#8232;&#8232;&#8232;<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n BOOK THREE: TO GREEN ANGEL TOWER<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\nThe evil minions of the undead Sithi Storm King are beginning their final preparations for the kingdom-shattering culmination of their dark sorceries, drawing King Elias ever deeper into their nightmarish, spell-spun world.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n As the Storm King&rsquo;s power grows and the boundaries of time begin to blur, the loyal allies of Prince Josua struggle to rally their forces at the Stone of Farewell. There, too, Simon and the surviving members of the League of the Scroll have gathered for a desperate attempt to unravel mysteries from the forgotten past. <br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n For if the League can reclaim these age-old secrets of magic long-buried beneath the dusts of time, they may be able to reveal to Josua and his army the only means of striking down the unslayable foe....<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n After the landmark Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn trilogy, the epic saga of Osten Ard continues with the brand-new novel, The Heart of What Was Lost. Then don&rsquo;t miss the upcoming trilogy, The Last King of Osten Ard, beginning with The Witchwood Crown!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for Osten Ard:<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Inspired me to write my own seven-book trilogy.... It&rsquo;s one of my favorite fantasy series.&rdquo;<br />\r\n &mdash;George R. R. Martin, New York Times-bestselling author of A Game of Thrones<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Groundbreaking...changed how people thought of the genre, and paved the way for so much modern fantasy. Including mine.&rdquo;<br />\r\n &mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times-bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n&ldquo;Tad Williams is a master storyteller, and the Osten Ard books are his masterpiece.&rdquo; &mdash;Brandon Sanderson,&#160;New York Times-bestselling author of&#160;Mistborn<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn is one of the great fantasy epics of all time.&rdquo;<br />\r\n &mdash;Christopher Paolini, New York Times-bestselling author of Eragon</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n      options.data[\'formy_form_token\'] = "49c82cd0a37475fbbf254b9fd23fbfc7";\n                }\n                else{\n                    options.data += "&formy_form_token=49c82cd0a37475fbbf254b9fd23fbfc7";\n                }\n\n            }\n            return _oldAjax(options);\n        };\n    })();\n\n    $(document).ready(function(){\n        var selector = $(\'form[method="post"]\');\n        if(selector.on){\n            selector.on(\'submit\', function(){\n                $(\'<input />\').attr(\'type\', \'hidden\')\n                    .attr(\'name\', "formy_form_token")\n                    .attr(\'value\', "49c82cd0a37475fbbf254b9fd23fbfc7")\n                    .appendTo(this);\n                return true;\n            })\n         .attr(\'value\', "49c82cd0a37475fbbf254b9fd23fbfc7")\n                    .appendTo(this);\n                return true;\n            })\n        }\n    });\n</script><div id="footer" 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9781524735456.jpg', None, 'New York Times-bestselling Tad Williams’ ground-breaking epic fantasy saga of Osten Ard begins an exciting new cycle!\xa0 \xa0 The perfect introduction to the epic fantasy world of Osten Ard, The Heart of What Was Lost is Tad Williams’ follow-up to his internationally bestselling landmark trilogy. Osten Ard inspired a generation of modern fantasy writers, including George R.R. Martin, Patrick Rothfuss, and Christopher Paolini, and defined Tad Williams as one of the most important fantasy writers of our time. \u2028\u2028\u2028\u2028 \xa0 A NOVEL OF OSTEN ARD \xa0 At the end of Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn, Ineluki the Storm King, an undead spirit of horrifying, demonic power, came within moments of stopping Time itself and obliterating humankind. He was defeated by a coalition of mortal men and women joined by his own deathless descendants, the Sithi.  In the wake of the Storm King’s fall, Ineluki’s loyal minions, the Norns, dark cousins to the Sithi, choose to flee the lands of men and retreat north to Nakkiga, their ancient citadel within the hollow heart of the mountain called Stormspike. But as the defeated Norns make their way to this last haven, the mortal Rimmersman Duke Isgrimnur leads an army in pursuit, determined to end the Norns’ attacks and defeat their ageless Queen Utuk’ku for all time.  Two southern soldiers, Porto and Endri, joined the mortal army to help achieve this ambitious goal—though as they venture farther and farther into the frozen north, braving the fierce resistance and deadly magics of the retreating Norns, they cannot help but wonder what they are doing so very far from home. Meanwhile, the Norns must now confront the prospect of extinction at the hands of Isgrimnur and his mortal army.  Viyeki, a leader of the Norns’ military engineers, the Order of Builders, desperately seeks a way to help his people reach their mountain—and then stave off the destruction of their race. For the two armies will finally clash in a battle to be remembered as the Siege of Nakkiga; a battle so strange and deadly, so wracked with dark enchantment, that it threatens to destroy not just one side but quite possibly all.  Trapped inside the mountain as the mortals batter at Nakkiga’s gates, Viyeki the Builder will discover disturbing secrets about his own people, mysteries both present and past, represented by the priceless gem known as The Heart of What Was Lost.  \xa0 Praise for Osten Ard: \xa0 “Inspired me to write my own seven-book trilogy.... Osten Ard inspired a generation of modern fantasy writers, including George R.R. Martin, Patrick Rothfuss, and Christopher Paolini, and defined Tad Williams as one of the most important fantasy writers of our time. &amp;#8232;&amp;#8232;&amp;#8232;&amp;#8232;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n A NOVEL OF OSTEN ARD&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nAt the end of Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn, Ineluki the Storm King, an undead spirit of horrifying, demonic power, came within moments of stopping Time itself and obliterating humankind. He was defeated by a coalition of mortal men and women joined by his own deathless descendants, the Sithi. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nIn the wake of the Storm King&amp;rsquo;s fall, Ineluki&amp;rsquo;s loyal minions, the Norns, dark cousins to the Sithi, choose to flee the lands of men and retreat north to Nakkiga, their ancient citadel within the hollow heart of the mountain called Stormspike. But as the defeated Norns make their way to this last haven, the mortal Rimmersman Duke Isgrimnur leads an army in pursuit, determined to end the Norns&amp;rsquo; attacks and defeat their ageless Queen Utuk&amp;rsquo;ku for all time. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nTwo southern soldiers, Porto and Endri, joined the mortal army to help achieve this ambitious goal&amp;mdash;though as they venture farther and farther into the frozen north, braving the fierce resistance and deadly magics of the retreating Norns, they cannot help but wonder what they are doing so very far from home. Meanwhile, the Norns must now confront the prospect of extinction at the hands of Isgrimnur and his mortal army. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nViyeki, a leader of the Norns&amp;rsquo; military engineers, the Order of Builders, desperately seeks a way to help his people reach their mountain&amp;mdash;and then stave off the destruction of their race. For the two armies will finally clash in a battle to be remembered as the Siege of Nakkiga; a battle so strange and deadly, so wracked with dark enchantment, that it threatens to destroy not just one side but quite possibly all. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nTrapped inside the mountain as the mortals batter at Nakkiga&amp;rsquo;s gates, Viyeki the Builder will discover disturbing secrets about his own people, mysteries both present and past, represented by the priceless gem known as The Heart of What Was Lost. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Praise for Osten Ard:&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Inspired me to write my own seven-book trilogy....                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8690/tad-williams">Tad Williams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/25999/andrew-wincott">Andrew Wincott</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Penguin Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">January 2017</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">9 hours 36 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">New York Times-bestselling Tad Williams&rsquo; ground-breaking epic fantasy saga of Osten Ard begins an exciting new cycle!&#160;<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n The perfect introduction to the epic fantasy world of Osten Ard, The Heart of What Was Lost is Tad Williams&rsquo; follow-up to his internationally bestselling landmark trilogy. Osten Ard inspired a generation of modern fantasy writers, including George R.R. Martin, Patrick Rothfuss, and Christopher Paolini, and defined Tad Williams as one of the most important fantasy writers of our time. &#8232;&#8232;&#8232;&#8232;<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n A NOVEL OF OSTEN ARD<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\nAt the end of Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn, Ineluki the Storm King, an undead spirit of horrifying, demonic power, came within moments of stopping Time itself and obliterating humankind. He was defeated by a coalition of mortal men and women joined by his own deathless descendants, the Sithi. <br />\r\n<br />\r\nIn the wake of the Storm King&rsquo;s fall, Ineluki&rsquo;s loyal minions, the Norns, dark cousins to the Sithi, choose to flee the lands of men and retreat north to Nakkiga, their ancient citadel within the hollow heart of the mountain called Stormspike. But as the defeated Norns make their way to this last haven, the mortal Rimmersman Duke Isgrimnur leads an army in pursuit, determined to end the Norns&rsquo; attacks and defeat their ageless Queen Utuk&rsquo;ku for all time. <br />\r\n<br />\r\nTwo southern soldiers, Porto and Endri, joined the mortal army to help achieve this ambitious goal&mdash;though as they venture farther and farther into the frozen north, braving the fierce resistance and deadly magics of the retreating Norns, they cannot help but wonder what they are doing so very far from home. Meanwhile, the Norns must now confront the prospect of extinction at the hands of Isgrimnur and his mortal army. <br />\r\n<br />\r\nViyeki, a leader of the Norns&rsquo; military engineers, the Order of Builders, desperately seeks a way to help his people reach their mountain&mdash;and then stave off the destruction of their race. For the two armies will finally clash in a battle to be remembered as the Siege of Nakkiga; a battle so strange and deadly, so wracked with dark enchantment, that it threatens to destroy not just one side but quite possibly all. <br />\r\n<br />\r\nTrapped inside the mountain as the mortals batter at Nakkiga&rsquo;s gates, Viyeki the Builder will discover disturbing secrets about his own people, mysteries both present and past, represented by the priceless gem known as The Heart of What Was Lost. <br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for Osten Ard:<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Inspired me to write my own seven-book trilogy.... It&rsquo;s one of my favorite fantasy series.&rdquo;<br />\r\n &mdash;George R. R. Martin, New York Times-bestselling author of The Game of Thrones<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Groundbreaking...changed how people thought of the genre, and paved the way for so much modern fantasy. Including mine.&rdquo;<br />\r\n &mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times-bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n&ldquo;Tad Williams is a master storyteller, and the Osten Ard books are his masterpiece.&rdquo; &mdash;Brandon Sanderson,&#160;New York Times-bestselling author of&#160;Mistborn<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn is one of the great fantasy epics of all time.&rdquo;<br />\r\n &mdash;Christopher Paolini, New York Times-bestselling author of Eragon</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy" genre-id="1"><span itemprop="title">Science Fiction & Fantasy</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/science_fiction_and_fantasy/fantasy" genre-id="2"><span itemprop="title">Fantasy</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div class="line"></div>\r\n\r\n                    <!-- Similar Titles and Also Customers Bought Tab Widget -->\r\n                    <div class="tab_widget" id="book-details-similar-titles-tab">\r\n                        <ul class="tabs">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<li class="active"><a href="#tab-similar" data-href="#tab-similar">Similar Titles</a></li>\r\n                        </ul>\r\n                        <div class="tab_container">\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<div id="tab-similar" data-context="/categoryList/similarTitles" data-bookId="281264" class="shelf tab_content clearfix" style="display: block;">\r\n                            </div>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                    </div>\r\n\r\n\t\t\t\t\t                    <!-- Reviews and Social Buzz Tab Widget -->\r\n                    <div class="tab_widget" id="book-details-reviews-tab">\r\n                        <ul class="tabs">\r\n                        \t\t                            \t<li class="active"><a href="#tab-reviews" data-href="#tab-reviews"><i class="icon-star"></i> Reviews</a></li>\r\n                                                        <!-- <li class=""><a href="#tab-social" data-href="#tab-social"><i class="icon-comments"></i> Social Buzz</a></li> -->\r\n                        </ul>\r\n                        <div class="tab_container">\r\n                            <div id="tab-reviews" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: block;">\r\n                                <ul class="sposts-list clearfix">\r\n                                                                    \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Suzanne S</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="5"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">Great book that is the perfect lead-in for the next, long hoped for series from TW.  The point of view includes one solidly from the very alien perspective of the Norns which is really interesting and broadly expands the view presented in the first series.  It\'s difficult to return to a most beloved series with growth and not trip up.  Well done.  \nNarration... it took a few chapters to catch the cadence and not have to roll back and repeat but that\'s because the narrator has developed character accents that do give the sense that they are speaking totally different languages.  Ultimately that\'s a positive but it did take me a while to catch on so... don\'t give up!  The story is worth it.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                </ul>\r\n                            </div>\r\n                            <div id="tab-social" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: none;">Donec in tortor in lectus iaculis vulputate. Sed aliquam, urna ut sollicitudin molestie, lacus justo aliquam mauris, interdum aliquam sapien nisi cursus mauris. Nunc hendrerit tortor vitae est placerat ut varius erat posuere. Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus.</div>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                    </div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\r\n      </div>\r\n                                                                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8690/tad-williams">Tad Williams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/25999/andrew-wincott">Andrew Wincott</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Penguin Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">November 2016</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">63 hours 9 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">New York Times-bestselling Tad Williams&rsquo; landmark epic fantasy saga of Osten Ard begins an exciting new cycle! <br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;One of my favorite fantasy series.&rdquo; &mdash;George R. R. Martin &bull; &ldquo;Groundbreaking.&rdquo; &mdash;Patrick Rothfuss &bull; &ldquo;One of the great fantasy epics of all time.&rdquo; &mdash;Christopher Paolini<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Tad Williams introduced readers to the incredible fantasy world of Osten Ard in his internationally bestselling series Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn. The trilogy inspired a generation of modern fantasy writers, including George R.R. Martin, Patrick Rothfuss, and Christopher Paolini, and defined Tad Williams as one of the most important fantasy writers of our time. &#8232;&#8232;&#8232;&#8232;<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n BOOK THREE: TO GREEN ANGEL TOWER<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\nThe evil minions of the undead Sithi Storm King are beginning their final preparations for the kingdom-shattering culmination of their dark sorceries, drawing King Elias ever deeper into their nightmarish, spell-spun world.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n As the Storm King&rsquo;s power grows and the boundaries of time begin to blur, the loyal allies of Prince Josua struggle to rally their forces at the Stone of Farewell. There, too, Simon and the surviving members of the League of the Scroll have gathered for a desperate attempt to unravel mysteries from the forgotten past. <br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n For if the League can reclaim these age-old secrets of magic long-buried beneath the dusts of time, they may be able to reveal to Josua and his army the only means of striking down the unslayable foe....<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n After the landmark Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn trilogy, the epic saga of Osten Ard continues with the brand-new novel, The Heart of What Was Lost. Then don&rsquo;t miss the upcoming trilogy, The Last King of Osten Ard, beginning with The Witchwood Crown!<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n Praise for Osten Ard:<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Inspired me to write my own seven-book trilogy.... It&rsquo;s one of my favorite fantasy series.&rdquo;<br />\r\n &mdash;George R. R. Martin, New York Times-bestselling author of A Game of Thrones<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Groundbreaking...changed how people thought of the genre, and paved the way for so much modern fantasy. Including mine.&rdquo;<br />\r\n &mdash;Patrick Rothfuss, New York Times-bestselling author of The Name of the Wind<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n&ldquo;Tad Williams is a master storyteller, and the Osten Ard books are his masterpiece.&rdquo; &mdash;Brandon Sanderson,&#160;New York Times-bestselling author of&#160;Mistborn<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn is one of the great fantasy epics of all time.&rdquo;<br />\r\n &mdash;Christopher Paolini, New York Times-bestselling author of Eragon</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9781524735456.jpg', None, 'New York Times-bestselling Tad Williams’ ground-breaking epic fantasy saga of Osten Ard begins an exciting new cycle!\xa0 \xa0 The perfect introduction to the epic fantasy world of Osten Ard, The Heart of What Was Lost is Tad Williams’ follow-up to his internationally bestselling landmark trilogy. Osten Ard inspired a generation of modern fantasy writers, including George R.R. Martin, Patrick Rothfuss, and Christopher Paolini, and defined Tad Williams as one of the most important fantasy writers of our time. \u2028\u2028\u2028\u2028 \xa0 A NOVEL OF OSTEN ARD \xa0 At the end of Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn, Ineluki the Storm King, an undead spirit of horrifying, demonic power, came within moments of stopping Time itself and obliterating humankind. He was defeated by a coalition of mortal men and women joined by his own deathless descendants, the Sithi.  In the wake of the Storm King’s fall, Ineluki’s loyal minions, the Norns, dark cousins to the Sithi, choose to flee the lands of men and retreat north to Nakkiga, their ancient citadel within the hollow heart of the mountain called Stormspike. But as the defeated Norns make their way to this last haven, the mortal Rimmersman Duke Isgrimnur leads an army in pursuit, determined to end the Norns’ attacks and defeat their ageless Queen Utuk’ku for all time.  Two southern soldiers, Porto and Endri, joined the mortal army to help achieve this ambitious goal—though as they venture farther and farther into the frozen north, braving the fierce resistance and deadly magics of the retreating Norns, they cannot help but wonder what they are doing so very far from home. Meanwhile, the Norns must now confront the prospect of extinction at the hands of Isgrimnur and his mortal army.  Viyeki, a leader of the Norns’ military engineers, the Order of Builders, desperately seeks a way to help his people reach their mountain—and then stave off the destruction of their race. For the two armies will finally clash in a battle to be remembered as the Siege of Nakkiga; a battle so strange and deadly, so wracked with dark enchantment, that it threatens to destroy not just one side but quite possibly all.  Trapped inside the mountain as the mortals batter at Nakkiga’s gates, Viyeki the Builder will discover disturbing secrets about his own people, mysteries both present and past, represented by the priceless gem known as The Heart of What Was Lost.  \xa0 Praise for Osten Ard: \xa0 “Inspired me to write my own seven-book trilogy.... Osten Ard inspired a generation of modern fantasy writers, including George R.R. Martin, Patrick Rothfuss, and Christopher Paolini, and defined Tad Williams as one of the most important fantasy writers of our time. &amp;#8232;&amp;#8232;&amp;#8232;&amp;#8232;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n A NOVEL OF OSTEN ARD&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nAt the end of Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn, Ineluki the Storm King, an undead spirit of horrifying, demonic power, came within moments of stopping Time itself and obliterating humankind. He was defeated by a coalition of mortal men and women joined by his own deathless descendants, the Sithi. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nIn the wake of the Storm King&amp;rsquo;s fall, Ineluki&amp;rsquo;s loyal minions, the Norns, dark cousins to the Sithi, choose to flee the lands of men and retreat north to Nakkiga, their ancient citadel within the hollow heart of the mountain called Stormspike. But as the defeated Norns make their way to this last haven, the mortal Rimmersman Duke Isgrimnur leads an army in pursuit, determined to end the Norns&amp;rsquo; attacks and defeat their ageless Queen Utuk&amp;rsquo;ku for all time. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nTwo southern soldiers, Porto and Endri, joined the mortal army to help achieve this ambitious goal&amp;mdash;though as they venture farther and farther into the frozen north, braving the fierce resistance and deadly magics of the retreating Norns, they cannot help but wonder what they are doing so very far from home. Meanwhile, the Norns must now confront the prospect of extinction at the hands of Isgrimnur and his mortal army. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nViyeki, a leader of the Norns&amp;rsquo; military engineers, the Order of Builders, desperately seeks a way to help his people reach their mountain&amp;mdash;and then stave off the destruction of their race. For the two armies will finally clash in a battle to be remembered as the Siege of Nakkiga; a battle so strange and deadly, so wracked with dark enchantment, that it threatens to destroy not just one side but quite possibly all. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nTrapped inside the mountain as the mortals batter at Nakkiga&amp;rsquo;s gates, Viyeki the Builder will discover disturbing secrets about his own people, mysteries both present and past, represented by the priceless gem known as The Heart of What Was Lost. &lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n Praise for Osten Ard:&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &amp;ldquo;Inspired me to write my own seven-book trilogy.... v=t.createElement("script");\nv.src=c,v.async=!0,v.id="_uasdk",v.rel=e,t.head.appendChild(v)}(window,document,\'https://web-sdk.urbanairship.com/notify/v1/ua-sdk.min.js\',\n  \'UA\', {\n    appKey: uaState;\n\n\t\tif (!sdk.isSupported) {\n\t\t\tuaState = "Unsupported";\n\t\t}\n\t\telse if (!sdk.canRegister) {\n\t\t\tuaState = "Blocked";\n\t\t}\n\t\telse if (sdk.channel.optedIn) {\n\t\t\tuaState                  <div class="clearfix audiobookVersion">\r\n                            <h4 class="fleft nobold">Unabridged Audiobook\r\n
